Volume reduced to a pleasant level now.2)I built a wood housing that surrounds the IR Detector unit with a opening protuding 8 inches beyond the unit. This blocked the IR noise and made the unit very stable :0)... Driveway Patrol Alarm system and the fixes were easy for me, I am happy with the product.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: Scott R.
Reviews.Content: Living near the bay as we do, we've had problems with people taking a stroll down our driveway in order to "just take a look."Looking around for a solution, I came across this product, and figured for [$], I can't go too wrong.So, does it work? Well, this is an updated review: the alarm goes off without rhyme or reason--sometimes at 2 AM--and often stays on for a minute or so. Very annoying. The unit has been disconnected.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product.  Reliable, simple, inexpensive, & effective.
Reviews.Author: Brian Newberry "Say something about yourself!"
Reviews.Content: The short end is this: Driveway Patrol Sensor is one of the BEST and least expensive models of its kind.  It is well-manufactured, simple to use, its chime is audible, and the system works reliably. The retail price fluctuates between $ 15 and $30, making this among the least expensive of its kind.As you might guess - this system comes in two parts (each about the size of a mug).  1.  The "OUTSIDE MOTION SENSOR" (which actually detects people as they approach)  2.  The "INSIDE CHIME BOX" (its chime notifies you with an audible, yet pleasant "DING-DONG" sound).Of course the beauty is - these two units can be VERY far apart (400 feet, according to the box).*HOW IT WORKS*Place the "MOTION SENSOR" (the smaller unit) near your front door, or anywhere you expect outside people to approach your home (whether friendly, hostile or census takers).Next, you place the other unit (the noise-making "CHIME BOX") inside your home.When an outsider approaches the "SENSOR" at your front door - you hear the "CHIME" inside your bedroom .  Again - the exact locations YOU need may vary.  Instead of your bedroom (or wherever); you might want the CHIME BOX to alert you in your office.***VOLUME CONTROL***The CHIME BOX can be set to "LOW" or "HIGH" volume, and "LOW Volume" is still pretty darn loud.  We set our CHIME BOX to "LOW" volume, and put it inside our towel closet NEAR our bedrooom, and close the door.  That way it's loud, but not TOO LOUD, we can still hear it just fine.Each unit has a small hole designed so it can be hung from a nail.  OR - both units are flat at the base, so you can set it on a table or your desk.ADDITIONAL SECURITY INFORMATION:The outdoor "sensor" has a small red LED light which illuminates when it detects motion.  I suppose this COULD be a good thing - if you want potential thieves to know they've been detected; perhaps scare them off.  But I personally don't want the outside people to KNOW that they've been detected (suppose I grew up on too much James Bond & Mission Impossible).I cover that little red light with black duct-tape.  Of course I don't cover the MOTION SENSOR itself; just the little red light.In addition to covering the light - I also ensure the CHIME BOX canNOT be heard by anyone outside my apartment.  And then evil intruders (as well as my friendly guests) are UNAWARE THEY HAVE BEEN DETECTED.At first - I was disappointed that the battery cover (on the "MOTION SENSOR" unit) requires a PHILLIPS HEAD screwdriver to open.Then another amazon reviewer informed me - many crooks will wait till I leave the house to remove the battery.  That way, once I'm home - they can approach my door without my knowledge (e.g. home invasion robbery).The other unit (the "RECEIVER / CHIME" unit) has a simple little thumb latch which opens easily with (appropriately enough) just your thumb!The sensor is extremely sensitive, and can be positioned in different ways to yield different sensivities.  For example - with the architecture around my front door, I find the MOTION SENSOR works better if hanged upside down.  I hung it on a regular  nail & it worked OK.  But then I tried hanging it upside down & it worked even better (I just wrapped a rubberband around it, & hang the rubber band on the nail).  Works like a charm.SUMMARY.Besides being a genuinely good security product, it's fun because my friends think I've got ESP.  BUY THIS!  At all levels, you'll dig it!

Reviews.Title: Driveway Patrol
Reviews.Author: F. Turcotte
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful product and very dependable. We can't see the back of our driveway from the house so this lets us know if someone has pulled in.

Reviews.Title: Limited Value Buy - Update!
Reviews.Author: J_Onyx "I never let my schooling interfere wi...
Reviews.Content: UPDATE - I lowered rating to 2 stars. I would not buy this again. Mine worked well until the first set of batteries were down, exactly five days after my Amazon deadline to return it! The sensor and receiver lights still come on but the alarm no longer works making it useless! Mine worked well as a motion alarm until the sound quit. This is not a quality made product. I'm going to try the more expensive one made by another company.I call this motion sensor system a limited good value buy due to its downfalls that despite the low price will be a deal breaker for many people. I'm a gadget guy and I'm budget minded in that I practice money management. I let go of my money at least as hard as it is to get it.To save a penny or two, someone (not "they" or the "company") decided to broaden acceptable manufacturing specs such that the motion sensor is enough out of round on both ends that a light wind will cause it to rotate and set off the Chimes.To hype sensor sensitivity or save a penny by using the most common off the shelf 180 degree sensor, usefulness is  reduced.I've been experimenting with this unit since I got it to see what exactly I can do with it. People can walk across my driveway on the sidewalk & not activate the chime but a car, SUV.or truck passing by the same way on the street sets it off every time.What many people want is a more focused sensor like mall stores had to compensate for having a wide open door way. More like an light beam straight line that chimes when something passes through. Like it is with hearing aids, the sensor industry has not kept up with the digital revolution. The Chinese have a less MBA notion of profit. Guess I'll have to search Chinese retailers for the inexpensive, low energy, feature rich security sensor  digital revolution technology makes possible.

Reviews.Title: How to use as a mail box alert.
Reviews.Author: The Reader
Reviews.Content: I have been using a couple of these Driveway Patrol Sensors for more than a year (purchased end of Mar, 2011) and they are still working just fine. They have good range (50+ feet through several walls) and over a year battery life in both the transmitter/sensor and receiver. The range of the transmitter/sensor can be dramatically extended by following the procedure described below.I use one of the transmitters in my mail box so I know when I have mail. It also alerts me to when the delivery person does not securely shut the door on the mail box.Here is how to extend the range and get the signal out of the metal mail box. First open up the plastic transmitter case by removing the 4 little screws on the back. Locate the white antenna wire that is coiled around the inside of the case and fish it out thorough the weep hole in the bottom of the case. The antenna wire is about 12 inches long when extended. Drill a hole in the bottom/back of the mail box and fish the antenna wire to the outside while placing the transmitter to the rear of the box. Double stick Velcro tape works good for holding the transmitter in place at the rear of the mail box.Update Sep, 2012: 18 months have passed since purchase and both units are still working as good as new. I just replaced the transmitter 9V and the three reciever "c" cells. A year and half continious use on one set of batteries is amazing! I notice the price has gone up about 30% since I bought mine.

Reviews.Title: Great for Traveling !
Reviews.Author: James Byrd Mcintyre "Bay Guy"
Reviews.Content: This Motion Detector is awesome when you travel. I set it on the dash of my car and take the alarm/receiver to the room . If anyone gets inside my car , I will be immediatly awaken and can call security and check on my car . This thing is awesome .... now I can sleep well when I travel knowing that the things in my car are safe and OK !

Reviews.Title: not satisfy
Reviews.Author: PHONG T HUYNH
Reviews.Content: I bought this sensor in Nov. 2010.It was working only about the first 3 months. Then, the receiver keep chiming non stop. I end up not using it.I don't recommend to buy this product.

Reviews.Title: Alarm will not stop
Reviews.Author: Silverpony "SP"
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my business to alert me when I was in the back room and someone opened the door - worked great for the first couple of months-now the alarm will not turn off. Nothing is effecting the unit -motion,batteries light,tempeture,or sound but the alarm still will not shut off  1. Is indoors, so weather conditions do not apply  2. Placed on floor under a cabinet, so bright light does not apply,  3. Moved to dark location off the floor where there can be no movement-no luck  4. Changed batteries-did not fix the problem.  5. Hid sensor in a drawer-turned on receiver (placed it in a  drawer in a different room)and the alarm has not stopped and is still going after 25 minutes!Total waste of money!

Reviews.Title: alarm system
Reviews.Author: jim williams
Reviews.Content: i tried an alarm system from harbor freight that did not work,so i thought i would try one from svm products. that was a mistake,because this one was worse than the other one.i guess i am not suppose to have a driveway alarm system

Reviews.Title: False alarms and not weatherproof
Reviews.Author: NIK
Reviews.Content: Worked great for a few days, but everything would set if off, like birds, wind, leaves. I unplugged it because it went off dozens of times a day. When the seasons changed I thought I'd try it again so I plugged back in the alarm, but ants got into it and messed it up. Cleaned that up, then rain got in and fried it completely. Great way to waste money.

Reviews.Title: Random detections; receiver died after about a month
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: This alarm had problems from the start. I tried different positions/angles and it would work reliably for a few days and just stop. The outside part always worked because I saw the red light come on everytime I drove or walked past it, but the inside part stopped responding, I know this because I kept the receiver in my upstairs window (because it only seemed to work when it had a direct line of sight) and the receiver would light up when it worked. I had this for roughly a month when the receiver completely died. A side note; this is very cheaply made. The plastic battery cover on the back of the outdoor part snapped off easily when I changed the batteries; I had to use duct tape to keep them in. It is a small investment so take the risk if you want. I would not buy this again.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your time.  Seriously, consider returning before it is too late if you did order it
Reviews.Author: Bryce Jackson
Reviews.Content: Battery compartment would not even unscrew so I could put the thing to work.  What's with the tiny screws you have to find a specialty screwdriver for in order to open the compartment?  Do they think battery thieves are going to open it and steal your battery?  Why wouldn't the thief just steal the whole unit?  Oh those foolish Chinese.  This is a surefire return, products like this make you glad for Amazon's no-hassle return policy.  I can see where the other reviewers that were able to install the batteries and put it to work called it junk, what are we thinking to spend a seventh of the price on a driveway alarm and expect it to work well?  It won't.  I was disgusted to see the little 'as seen on tv' logo stamped on the box when it came.  Had I paid more attention to the seller's name when I bought it, I would have been forewarned.  But they don't exactly put that name in very large font when you're shopping, but it is a nice lesson to learn to look for that next time.  I know products marked as such are novelties, gimmicks and not worth wasting your time on.  But I thought I would give it a shot since it was already in my house.  But it's shoddy design and cheap manufacturing methods insured that it would be returned.

Reviews.Title: Works as described.
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item and so far very happy with it. I installed it in the garage and It works very good.

Reviews.Title: Effective but needs a muffler...
Reviews.Author: C. Jones
Reviews.Content: I found the distance and sensitivity to be great for this driveway device. Its actually going to be used to monitor elderly parents with dementia.There are a couple of drawbacks but both easily overcome.First, the sensor itself runs off a 9 volt battery which is cumbersome so I converted this over to a wall adapter.Second, the receiver is too loud, as many others have pointed out but this can be corrected by disassembling the receiver and taping over the speaker. After reassembling, tape over the slots where the sound comes out.Other than those two items, I would purchase this again.

Reviews.Title: Will try item,, "AGAIN".
Reviews.Author: Jo-Bob -- Mont,Wv.
Reviews.Content: I can not give an accurate rating on this purchase. It has been in use for less than 30 days, (replacement item). However,on the first one, the sensor,(transmitter),went south,(Mexico, Isuspect),after less than 60 days in service,and that equates to me,,less than one (1) STAR... AND, if I didn't need it, I wouldnot have ordered a second unit.Feedback on(2nd)replacement item,it has lasted around 90 days,and it too,went south.I have 2 excellent receivers, and 2 trashed transmitters. "SAVE YOUR MONEY".

Reviews.Title: Driveway Patrol Sensor
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: I went to install it today now that we finally have some good weather.  The product appears to be DOA (Dead on Arrival).  It looks like the remote sensing unit works as the red led lights upon movement but the receiver doesn't work.  I tried two sets of new batteries and event the an external power adapter still no go.  Trying to get a replacement.  It looks like I need to pay for return shipping.

Reviews.Title: After a second try, its doing the job in colder temp
Reviews.Author: J. Kubik
Reviews.Content: We bought this because we have a late night prowler that we want to call the police for, but we never know when he's going to show up.  He's come into our yard at least 3 times in the last 10 days, and who knows how many more times before there was snow on the ground. Its very unnerving.  We find his tracks in snow in the morning but never manage to be awake when he's at our garage door or the neighbor's patio door (really creepy).  We got Driveway Patrol on Saturday night and tried putting it outside after adding batteries, but it chimed non-stop until we finally had to bring it in.  I was disappointed that we'd have to wait til Spring and more moderate temps (we're in Wisconsin.)  But we decided to give it one more try, and attached it to a nail on the outside of our white garage on Monday morning and it appears to be working consistently since then.  I'm not sure what the difference was: maybe putting it outside in the lesser cold of the morning vs. late night temps?  Whatever the initial problem was, it seems to be resolved.  We walked past it a number of times to test it, and at 1:30AM this morning we were awakened to its chiming.  We jumped out of our beds in time to see our prowler leaving our yard and heading down the alley - apparently unaware of the outdoor sensor unit.  Not sure if the police will be able to arrive in time to catch this creep if he's just checking doors and not spending time breaking into something, but its reassuring to know we can see what he's doing and try to get him picked up.  For less than $20, I say try it.

Reviews.Title: Does not work properly
Reviews.Author: Val
Reviews.Content: This alarm seemed like the perfect idea to alert me of cars coming up my driveway. Wrong! First, it did not go off when cars came in my driveway, even after we tested it several times and it worked just fine. Then one day it decided to go off non stop! And there was nothing there! We followed the instructions perfectly so it was not due to user error. This would be a great product if it worked properly. I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Great Item
Reviews.Author: Paw Paw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have talked about getting this for a while. My only regret is we did not get it sooner. It works great and we like knowing we have company prior to them knocking at the door. We live in a very rural area.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work at night
Reviews.Author: HVAC Doc "Hot Rod"
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money, work fine during the day but not at night.  Unfortunatly I painted the unit black because its so obvious in the bright white so I am unable to return it...and no I didn't paint over the detection area!

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Sellis
Reviews.Content: If someone or something is warm enough it will set it off. My wife is starting to complain about the false alarms. I have mine mounted underneath the front porch in the corner right below the ceiling and will still get false alarms.

Reviews.Title: Broken and defective
Reviews.Author: seeking security
Reviews.Content: I was really excited when the product arrived, but upon installing the two units at the front and back entrance of my driveway they did not work. One unit would beep intermittently, while the other unit did not work at all. This purchase was a total disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Throwing money down the drain
Reviews.Author: William
Reviews.Content: This is a worthless item. Yes it will alarm when you take it out of the box and pass your hand in front of the sensor. But useless as a Driveway Alert. False alarms, no alarm when it should, very short distance only and constant battery drain.

Reviews.Title: security alert
Reviews.Author: Di
Reviews.Content: We had a unique situation, moved into the 120 year old family farmhouse, which didn't havea doorbell. This seemed the perfect solution to letting us know when anyone was around. Reciever has a very loud alert. Love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Fork out a little more for something better!
Reviews.Author: Stover "Stover"
Reviews.Content: I purchased one to monitor my driveway. First of all, it doesn't have nearly the 400 foot range that it says it has. Also, if the sensor or reciever is placed in a metal building it will cut the range down even more. Lots of false alarms. My sensor was mounted to a fence post and I even built a three sided box around it to try and lesson the false alarms, but that hasn't helped much. You get what you pay for, so spend a little more and get something that works.

Reviews.Title: Driveway monitor
Reviews.Author: modeverything
Reviews.Content: Wow for the price this is awesome! My driveway is around 300 feet i wanted to put it at the end of the driveway but theres a garage in between the house and the end. I did try but it didn't work. So i moved it about 20' just beyond the garage in view of the house and it worked flawless. We had a massive rain today and not one false alarm. I didn't have any "size C" batteries so i took AA batteries and put them in the receiver u have to position them in between the spring and plate they are the same voltage just wont last as long. There is a high, low, and off, volume switch the low is perfect for inside and the high will make you blink if your within 20 feet it is very loud! if it is outside you would be able to easily hear it from  300 feet away. The tone reminds me of an old school doorbell "high chime followed by a low chime"  Theres also a few red lights on the receiver that light up when the sensor is tripped. for being a battery operated motion sensor it is unlike others because it picks up a person walking 20' away it seems to pick up everything level and above the sensor. at first it picked up my dog so i raised it to around 4 feet off the ground and now it wont pick him up witch means now it also wont pick up leaves blowing by or grass when the wind blows I have to say within the past year this is the best 15$ i'v spent!

Reviews.Title: Good product overall
Reviews.Author: Icognogolia
Reviews.Content: I bought this item because of all the positive feedback for it.The cons: My main complaint is that the sensor itself is the biggest motion sensor I have EVER seen, it's about 4" tall and 2.5" wide. It has a small red light on it that lights when the sensor is tripped, which the person tripping it might see. I put a piece of duct tape over it, which solved the problem.The pros: Mainly that it works really well. There has never been a time so far that it hasn't gone off when someone parked in my driveway. The price is excellent too.Good product overall.PS-another reviewer suggested putting it in a birdhouse. Going to try it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: rex62
Reviews.Content: Worked beautifully for monitoring the front door of my store. It's simply the most affordable, easiest, and most effective way of monitoring an area whether big or small.

Reviews.Title: It works pretty well
Reviews.Author: Armstrong
Reviews.Content: They are easy to install, easy to operate. Battery life has been good. Dependable and inexpensive. Try not to mount the sensor tightly to anything, this seemed to cause alot of false alarms. Also, sunlight hitting a moving tree branch tends to activate the alarm, so trim away any moving limbs or branches and I think you will be satisfied with this product. I have owned one of these for a couple years and it does nothing like the description says. As far as the previous review about going through a window...NO MOTION SENSOR WILL WORK THROUGH GLASS. Don't blame the product for your ignorance. The item works very well for me. I have a large yard with a detached garage and this inexpensive device lets me know when anyone is coming near my home. Mailman, newspaper guy, whoever. It will pick up animals, but with the right mounting height and electrical tape the sensor works as desired. Sensor takes (1)9V while receiver takes three)C batteries. The only option is the volume of the chime on the receiver. It will continually chime when something enters the sensor area.

Reviews.Title: Defective ... Junk ... Buyer beware.
Reviews.Author: chenbr
Reviews.Content: After I received this product, I installed three C size battery in the receiver. The light is on for a few seconds, and then it goes off. The sensor unit seems to work. I thought the receiver's batterys are bad. So I went out to buy the new battery. After I install the new battery again, the receiver is still unresponsive. It is frustrating. It is a waste of time and money. I think the seller knows this product is an unreliable piece of junk, so they sell it cheap. So, people won't even bother to return it. Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: Boo- don't waste your money!
Reviews.Author: mommyof3
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product, despite some of the reviews I have read. It worked twice and has not worked since. I guess you get what you pay for----> junk.

Reviews.Title: Driveway sensor
Reviews.Author: Alfred E. Richards
Reviews.Content: The product meets the needs I bought it for. I have a 300 foot long driveway and like knowing when someone has walked or driven in since trees obstruct a direct view of the gate area.  Satisfied customer, Al Richards

Reviews.Title: Driveway Patrol is Cheap and Worth every penny!!!
Reviews.Author: RWT
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Patrol a year ago for my driveway and it saved me from being mugged in my own carport at night. I love mine so well I've bought many more for my friends and relatives. You won't find a better alarm for the price.

Reviews.Title: Second time it worked
Reviews.Author: Ronald Parker
Reviews.Content: First delivery unit yielded a range of only 25-30 feet.  Replacement unit works fine- range of about 60 feet not 300 as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds
Reviews.Author: Thomas M. Scudiero
Reviews.Content: I am totally satisfied with this purchase.  We use it at our office/warehouse.  When our counterman is out on a delivery we turn it on and it lets us know when someone has entered the counter area.  The wireless part makes this a simple and great working device.

Reviews.Title: Great Security Gadget
Reviews.Author: wavecat
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these for the pool area. One I partially enclosed in a small tupperware-type container to protect it from rain. The second one is in the covered porch area. I have had no false alarms. Also, there's been a cat burglar in my community who likes to enter through the back porches and come through windows while folks are sleeping. I have the receiver next to my bed in case the burglar makes a visit. This unit will alert me to have time to deal with him. At 10.00 each, you really can't go wrong. Another use is that you can place the transmitter sensor inside your vehicle while its parked in the drive. If anyone enters the car, you'll be notified. Pretty cool gadget. I don't know why some are unhappy with it.Update 3/10/10: Sensors were activating for no apparent reason. New batteries alleviated the problem. Nice to know that the sensors let me know when it's time for a fresh battery. These things are a great added security measure.UPDATE 07/25/2011Still working great!January, 2014: Moved and took these with me to my new home. Same 2009 pair working perfectly!

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Tracy Anderson
Reviews.Content: This is a great product. My sister has a habit of walking in unannounced especially when I am in the back part of my house working with my computer. This device announces her arrival every time! The only complaint I would have is that it is pretty loud even on the "low" setting and that it rings three times when it is triggered...a thin piece of foam over the front of the receiver fixed this problem nicely. This is a great product for the price.

Reviews.Title: This is a toy
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: It works for the first week, on and off for the second week, totaly dead for the third week.  And it uses expnsive C batteries.  Give it to you children to put it in the play house.  That is where it should be.

Reviews.Title: worthless
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Gates
Reviews.Content: 400 feet i dont think so more like 4 inches with false alarms if it alarms at all

Reviews.Title: driveway patrol sensor
Reviews.Author: David A. Burnham
Reviews.Content: this is not a good product at all.  All we ever heard was the beeping noise. Heat effects it. Winds effect it. Bugs flying by effect it.  If it's raining it will not work covered or not.  Absolutely a waste of money. It was constantly going off. Not at all what we expected.  Returned the product for refund will look for something better.Would not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: great driveway sensor
Reviews.Author: Adelaide Zvaigzne "hot mamma"
Reviews.Content: This product is exactly as advertised. Sensor may have to adjusted initially because unit is very sensitive. But after that,unit works flawlessly even in sub-zero weather here in Wisconsin. As for those folks that are learry of buying Chinese made products,BELIEVE. The quality of this $11.30 item is fantastic.I would definitely recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: did not work
Reviews.Author: Willem Koole
Reviews.Content: I don't mind if something cheap I buy breaks in the first week or two.  But when I buy something cheap and it doesn't work ever, now that's a waste of money!  This was a waste of my time and money.

Reviews.Title: Hunk of Junk
Reviews.Author: Afterwork Student
Reviews.Content: Unit is pretty much junk. I guess you get what you pay for. Unit often fails to detect large people within 6 feet of sensor. Many failures of receiver at 12 feet on other side of wood and stucco wall with windows. If you want reliable detection of intruders, this is not the unit. Save your time and money and find something better.

Reviews.Title: FALSE ALARMS
Reviews.Author: S. Taylor
Reviews.Content: It works perfect at night. But during the day I have to shut the item off. It sends so many false alarms its annoying. Birds,leaves,limbs,cars on passing street, I mean everything sets this thing off during the day. But if you are concern mostly about dusk-dawn time. Then its a great investment.

Reviews.Title: Driveway Sensor Update to Review
Reviews.Author: J.Duffy
Reviews.Content: Updating my original review of this item. This is a handy product and worked well for the first 2 months. (changed batteries then 2x). I did not use it during the Winter months much due concern for moisture.  Then when I started using it again recently, it required constant battery changes (weekly) or it would beep loudly (you can hear it outside) continully.  With the price of batteries, I found it prohibitive. I asked for an exchange for another one that worked, and the seller would not comply (according to policies).  However, I did feel that it is under 1 year and they could have replaced it.  Due to this I will not buy from this particular seller again. This is the first product I have had this experience with and I order frequently from amazon. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Works, with some modificafion...
Reviews.Author: Stan C. Porch
Reviews.Content: This thing drove me nuts at first but I finally got it to work correctly.  If you don't put a shade over it, even the clouds passing overhead will set it off.  I had to tape down the sensor only leaving a 1/4" opening and put it inside of a box so the sun didn't hit it.  If you put it anywhere it gets hit by sunlight (even indirectly) it will gop off constantly.  After the tweaking, it is woth the price, but be prepared to spend some time getting it to work right.

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for!
Reviews.Author: starry_night
Reviews.Content: Our garage is always open.  And even though we keep our kids bikes chained up, I've been concerned about how someone could easily sneak in there and vandalize our vehicles.This device works PERFECT!It's VERY sensitive, the 1st night I used it, I kept flinging the door open, each time it sounded, just to find out that a car passing by on the street had set it off, or some people were going by on the sidewalk.After moving it around a bit, I found that facing the motion detector more towards my house and away from the street, was ideal.  It could still alert me if anyone was in my garage, without sounding the alarm everytime someone drove by.So yes, I'm very happy with it, and felt it was very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: Faulty product
Reviews.Author: Ocean Beach "Tester"
Reviews.Content: Product ceased working after 1 week.  I've replaced the batteries, but have decided that malfunction is with the product itself.  I guess you get what you pay for.  I'd recommend saving yourself the $20 for something else.

Reviews.Title: Quite Useful But Has Its Limitations
Reviews.Author: L. Erickson
Reviews.Content: I originally bought this off the shelf at Fry's. Liked the first one so much, I bought a second. Having said that, it does have its shortcomings. For instance, it gets set off by lots of leaves moving on a tree during a wind storm. You also have to be cognizant of exactly what you want to detect to be sure it detects that type of object and not others, such as, pets moving down low versus humans. Actually my biggest complaint is that it only has two sound levels for the alarm and the lowest is normally too loud for my preferences. It would be nice to have a more graduated volume control to fit your needs. I'd even pay another $5 or $10 for the feature. As an overall product, it probably only deserves 3 stars, but given its level of usefulness for its low price, I gave it an extra star.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful for telling when people are coming to your door.
Reviews.Author: Siri Sholten
Reviews.Content: I bought this so I would know when my dogs were at my back door. It works for even my cat. They just have to make movement and it will dingdong. I used to get up all the time to look and see if they were at the back door. Now I can relax and just listen.

Reviews.Title: Chime is too loud
Reviews.Author: Cosmo
Reviews.Content: Overall I'm pleased with the performance.  I fastened the sensor to the mailbox post and adjusted the sensor angle to not see traffic on the road.  My mailbox is behind a tree so I wanted the sensor to alert me to the arrival of my mail as well as anyone entering the driveway.  Sensor transmits a signal more than 90 feet to the house and unless the mailman is very gentle, it notifies me of mail delivery.  Also notifies me of visitors, phantoms, and wind gusts every afternoon.  The phantoms may be insects, birds or bunnies.  Not sure.

Reviews.Title: counts wind as motion!
Reviews.Author: Angie "Angie"
Reviews.Content: Be fully aware if you live in a windy area this sensor is pointless!  I live on a mountain and didn't realize that the wind would make it ding-dong every other second because of the wind.  Had to turn it off the first day we got it put up!

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Ed Thoden
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this. It lasted about 2 months then the receiver began alarming all the time, even with new batteries.

Reviews.Title: I'd buy it a fourth time
Reviews.Author: Charles G. King III
Reviews.Content: I've been using this product for several years.  It works very well.  However, the sensor is not quite as resilient to the weather as I would like.  It can take the rain for awhile, but eventually it gets wet inside and you have to take it apart and dry it all out, but eventually the damage is too severe to be repaired.  It helps to duct tape the seams, but this just extends the time you can leave it out.  Keeping it in a sheltered location helps a lot if you have one.  In spite of these things, each one has lasted a couple years before expiring.

Reviews.Title: Never worked properly
Reviews.Author: Roberta McElhenie
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product several years ago and it worked great.  I needed a new one (old one died after 3-4 years of use) and this one is the pits!  Exact same brand and mounted in exact same location as previous alarm but this one will not alert to vehicles in driveway or people walking by.  It did, however, alert to nothing at all...constantly!  I live in the country and need something to let me know if visitors are coming up the drive.  Sensor and receiver are within the appropriate distance to each other and mounted at a height to eliminate small wildlife triggers.  I tried taping off the sensor to narrow the range which made no difference.  It is such a convenience that I will be trying another brand and hoping for better results.

Reviews.Title: security for when I'm in the shop!
Reviews.Author: A Charlie brown "Lee G."
Reviews.Content: I live on a well traveled road, oft times working in the back yard of my shop {of which there is 5 acres}, which the front of the shop faces said road. And have had items "disappear" when the front dual garage doors are left open! {ventilation/wind E.T.C.} The nice thing about this is I can take the larger base unit with me, and set the sensor in such a way as not to be noticed. Not only does this give me piece of mind but keeps me from being surprised when friends stop by. The only reason for this particular rating is that the sensor has no switch to turn it off, [under the battery cover would be nice] which means constantly draining batteries, though I've found that keeping it in a dark drawer helps...

Reviews.Title: POS
Reviews.Author: kennychuck1 "kennychuck"
Reviews.Content: Dead on delivery.  Go team China!  I should have expected this.  It is what I get for being cheap.  Save yourself the aggravation and buy one of the Mighty Mule  Alarms.  I did and it works great.

Reviews.Title: Poor sensor
Reviews.Author: Railroad
Reviews.Content: Alarm didn't sound 50% of the time someone walked pass it.  Sometimes the bell rang nonstop for no apparent reason.  I threw it away after a month of aggravation.  Piece of plastic junk.

Reviews.Title: works well, in general
Reviews.Author: ken
Reviews.Content: I have 2 similar brands like this one, each being slightly different, but each works quite well. You need to understand infra-red sensors, so you'll know WHY, if it does not detect a person or car !

Reviews.Title: Great sensor
Reviews.Author: Tim-in-ny
Reviews.Content: I got this for my mother;s dog...my mother is hard of hearing and doesn't hear the dog barking to come in,,,so,,i set this sensor low by the door...the dog walks past it and the sensor sets off the alarm in the house,,,being wireless is great,,and its loud..great product

Reviews.Title: Drive way Patrol
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: work great let you know when some one is in your drive way or any place you need a warning when there is someone in a place you need a warning that someone is on your property.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Gordon Deines
Reviews.Content: I bought one about two years ago and it is still working great so when the need came up for another I did not hesitate to buy another.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the Silent Dog
Reviews.Author: JediNachos
Reviews.Content: So, if you have a dog that won't bark when it wants out... This is a Godsend!I mounted it by the door on an old bookend.  Placed on the floor.Now we know when the little stain maker needs to go outside.  :)

Reviews.Title: driveway patrol
Reviews.Author: Nancy King
Reviews.Content: Worked fine for about 4 months than just stopped working, was using it so I would know when my mom was trying to get up so I could help her

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: Anthony s.
Reviews.Content: This product is a waste of money and I can't even return it. Constantly sounds alarm when there is nothing crossing the sensor.  If you purchase this or similar product make sure there is a longer return period so you can see how it works in different weather conditions.  Windy days are the worst since it triggers the mechanism.  It will drive you and if you have pets crazy.

Reviews.Title: Great Tool
Reviews.Author: pipedreams57
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these back in 2007 while staying at a cheap motel in western KY where thieves were hitting cars & stuff on the parking lot at night. I had a motorcycle with a custom cover parked in a back corner there. I set this sensor up about 20 ft. from the bike to watch it at night. Three or 4 days later, the alarm unit went off at 2am. I looked to see a man laying on the ground un-tying my cover on the bike. I went out and caught him red-handed. The rest you don't need to know, haha.  Since then I have bought several more of these units and have them mounted around my property on small posts. They work very well within 200ft of the house and let me know when someone is trespassing or attempting to steal something. Makes a perfect and very cheap night watchman. Just bend a thin sheet of tin or aluminum for a roof over it to keep rain off and screw it to the pole. I highly recommend these for catching thieves and stray dogs. Just keep a good shotgun ready.

Reviews.Title: I like this very much!!!!
Reviews.Author: A Confidential
Reviews.Content: I use it to notify my if someone is at my door. I am not a fan of solicitors and want to know who or what is at my door. It is loud mind you.  But tolerable to me. Works great.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: E J Mason
Reviews.Content: Had good expectations for using them in the backyard however the system which uses three C batteries plus a nine volt battery only worked occasionally. Plan on returning it this week.

Reviews.Title: drive patrol
Reviews.Author: raul castaneda
Reviews.Content: i have had this item before and this is the reason i purchased another one,  i like it and it is very reliable.  i would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: Does not work!!
Reviews.Author: mike fox
Reviews.Content: This unit worked for one day and then quit alerting. Not reliable even at close range. DO NOT BUY at any price.

Reviews.Title: Works for me
Reviews.Author: Woody
Reviews.Content: We're frequently in the garage or back yard and can't here the door bell.  We could install an outdoor alarm to annoy the neighbors, but chose this instead.  Cheaper and simpler.  Only had it a month so I can't speak to longevity, but so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Great security
Reviews.Author: Tamarian S.
Reviews.Content: This is a great security product.It alerts you when someone comes onto your property.This product is recommended to those that would like to be notified when someone approach their property.

Reviews.Title: Love this Home monitoring detector system full motion detection & Now I feel much safer knowing mother has that extra awareness
Reviews.Author: DyingJedi
Reviews.Content: Love this Home monitoring detector system full motion detection & Now I feel much safer knowing mother has that extra awareness, we installed a few of these around house to notify my mom of intruders or visitors & man it works fantastic & as planned!We bought the whole kit!FYI, I was a full time caregiver for four years taking care of my loving grandmother of 98 in her last days of life which just happened I did such a good job she lived 4 years longer than everyone expected her to! Vanilla Ensure and Yogurt and Vitamins is what I have her daily! Onward to suggestions, I had gotten a few things to help in the quest to prevent my Grandma when she would get up by herself to go to bathroom she would fall often! I hadn't any rest or private time or peace of mind constantly worried about her to the point we connected in time. I could feel her breathing properly or not. a personal thing between the both of us!  SO I tried a few things and created a INSIDE CAMERA SYSTEM in various places in the house were she liked to sit and like to go, It worked for a while watching all the Recycled cellphone android IP Cameras streaming to a TABLET that displayed 9 cameras full time! In time the android Tiny monitor cam pro app worked and got better and better with an amazing DEV at the helm! Todays Tiny monitor cam PRO has motion detection built into the actually monitor app so no longer needing Motion detectors, Just needing really good camera at this point! Als I tried pull string alert systems that did in fact help me to arrive to grandma in time to help her to her destination! Looking back now though I would of have Much preferred these motion sensors in the long run with the full kit telling me where I need to go check out movement etc!In all this stuff is to help bring a caregiver peace of mind and help make easier to live alongside giving care to loved one!Enjoy Hi5 I hope anything I shared with you all may help you one day!Justin CramDyingJedi

Reviews.Title: Good product!!
Reviews.Author: Avid Reader
Reviews.Content: Works just like I wanted it to.  I placed it in my Mail Box to notify me when the mail has arrived...

Reviews.Title: driveway alert
Reviews.Author: Dennis Hatcher
Reviews.Content: I have had these before and they work good but the down side is that they don't last very long.  About 3 years is the best I have got Cost is cheap is why I buy more of these.  Overall I will buy again if available.

Reviews.Title: Driveway Patrol
Reviews.Author: Scot T. Esmay
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the Driveway Patrol sensor. I use it on my porch so I know when packages are being delivered since FedEx has forgotten how to ring doorbells. I plan on buying a couple more for security purposes.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: For an inexpensive driveway sensor this works well but you get what you pay for, no sensitivity adjustments are present and this can be a problem

Reviews.Title: 1st time I wrote a review
Reviews.Author: Tony L.
Reviews.Content: This product is not worth buying. The alarm sounds constantly. Must be a blade of grass that sets it off 400 yards away if there is a puff of wind. But get this. A car pass's it in my driveway, and it does not sound the alarm. I tried all the tricks with tape and stuff that the manufacturer said on the box, but nothing worked. I definately would have returned it, but it was over 30 days.

Reviews.Title: It Works ...
Reviews.Author: BansheeBriar
Reviews.Content: I live in the country and never know when someone is visiting until their standing at the front door.  So I took the advice of one reviewer who had carefully painted the unit to make it less visible and used some colored tape over that red light. I then put it into a plastic baggie to help protect it from the elements.  My first location had too many birds and squirrels so I moved it to a less popular spot. I have it placed about 4 feet off the ground so as not to detect stray dogs.  It does get the occasional false alarm. It's certainly not the best unit.  I don't keep the inside unit running all night. It is loud even on low.  But it does have an off switch which is good. For my purpose it serves as a cheap announcer. You can spend a lot of money on units that have similar problems. I wouldn't use this for any sort of major security as anyone can walk up and take it off it's mount. There isn't a way to truly secure it to anything.  But if your using it mainly as an announcer then it's a good find for the price. ** NOTE ** It doesn't work well in high winds. I learned quickly if there is a storm brewing just turn it off.  It is also LOUD.  I have yet to figure out a way to muffle the volume.  But still in all I do like the announcer.

Reviews.Title: Simple but efficient
Reviews.Author: Skip POLVINEN
Reviews.Content: Simple to use and it works efficiently. It is unfortunate that it is discontinued by the manufacturer. Inexpensive but it works.

Reviews.Title: Birds just want to have fun
Reviews.Author: Combustorbob
Reviews.Content: The package delivery folks are in too much of a hurry to knock on the door or ring the door bell, so I bought this and set it up on my front porch to let me know when anyone comes onto the porch. It works well, but my daughter keeps turning it off. It isn't too loud, the problem is there is this wild bird that likes to dance with the red light that blinks in the sensor when it is activated and it keeps sounding off. So if it wasn't for the bird, it would be just what I needed for the job.

Reviews.Title: Worked fine
Reviews.Author: Mr D "Mr D"
Reviews.Content: Works as expected- Used for security to put in places I could not always see while working-- has decent range - quite a few false alarms but that kept me awake and alert lol-- wind, sun moving and animals set it off- to be expected.

Reviews.Title: Super loud, sensor has a narrow field of range
Reviews.Author: Raleigh Pilgrim
Reviews.Content: Works pretty good, and the chime can be set loud, so you can hear it anywhere in the house. My only complaint is that if you mount it high, it has trouble picking up anything lower.

Reviews.Title: No more surprise unannounced visitors
Reviews.Author: martyarty
Reviews.Content: The driveway patrol is working reasonably well for us.  We have experienced false alarms on windy or wet days. We made a false birdhouse to mount the gadet in. The birds discovered it. It took a little while for them to fiqure out that it was not for them.

Reviews.Title: Too Sensitive
Reviews.Author: blancaJim
Reviews.Content: Needs a Sensitivity adjustment. Everything blowing in the wind sets it off, Blades of grass, My neighbors tree (50 feet away). I have tried different locations and the receiver keeps beeping when nobody is in my driveway. I thought the receivers hi low switch was for volume. But the sound is the same on both levels. and the switch does Not adjust Sensitivity.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work for me
Reviews.Author: Norman D. Marton
Reviews.Content: I initially installed this at my driveway hoping that it would detect someone entering an area around the garage door and cars parked in front.  The range is so short and narrow, it will nit detect most of the time at all.  I tried to reposition with no success.  T salvage the cost, I have put near my back door to alert me if someone was standing at the back door.  It sorta does that.  I am really back to square one.

Reviews.Title: does not work
Reviews.Author: Yossi Leverton
Reviews.Content: Have moved it around and until I did get it to work sometimes, but it does not work consistently.  I am using this inside, does not work for me.

Reviews.Title: I used this as a way to know someone was at my door.
Reviews.Author: Ms. W
Reviews.Content: The  birds and moving tree limbs from the wind would set it off. It worked, but to much other movement was on my porch for it to work as well as I would have liked.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money!
Reviews.Author: Rudy Sonnen
Reviews.Content: This product had no range! I might as well just sit there my self. I could not recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Thumbs down.
Reviews.Author: John Mathis
Reviews.Content: Worked when it wanted to whether there was motion or not. Kept moving it around to find it's sweet spot. Never found it. Was really glad when I finally accidentally ran over it. Now it has a legit reason to not work!

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!
Reviews.Author: Holly
Reviews.Content: It always lets me know if a dog, person or vehicle approaches my home! I love knowing when I need to get up and if I don't need to bother!

Reviews.Title: Nifty item
Reviews.Author: Helene Jarvis
Reviews.Content: No installation and it works almost all the time. Do not install it by trees that blow in the wind. It will pick up the signal of movement and you will have to turn it off. Received promptly and exactly as described.

Reviews.Title: Good safety item
Reviews.Author: Minnie Fretwell
Reviews.Content: I gave this as a gift to a family member and they are pleased with the choice.  They use it near the entrance gates to their property so that they are aware if someone opens a gate and comes uninvited onto their property.

Reviews.Title: Worthless
Reviews.Author: Gary J. Kuehn
Reviews.Content: Could not ever get it to set right.  The patrol sensor kept blinking and the monitor kept going off.  Kinda hard to sleep when the alarm is always going off.  I guess ya do get what ya pay for.

Reviews.Title: It works, but....
Reviews.Author: kathleen m. engstrom
Reviews.Content: Don't count on the range promised.  I bought the Driveway sensor for my mailbox at the end of my drive. It's useless for that purpose.  My driveway is long and there are trees between the mailbox and my house.  Maybe it's just too much interference, or distance.  I'm disappointed.  But the alert does work, so maybe I'll find another use for it.

Reviews.Title: GREAT !
Reviews.Author: Francisco R. Santos
Reviews.Content: I was not enthusiastic about this product initially. But when I set it up, it performed expected as I wished it would. It's been sounding off whenever somebody passed by my driveway to front stairs, warning me of approaching people ! Although it also sounded off whenever it's windy---I made sure plants leaves & others are well shielded or tied up. This s also very helpful whenever UPS or FEDEX made deliveries (they're terrible in NOT ringing the doorbell !!!)

Reviews.Title: Not too good
Reviews.Author: Robin
Reviews.Content: This item doesnt' work when giving rain. it only works when nice an dry an no bad weather.. Not good

Reviews.Title: These are fine alarms.
Reviews.Author: Donna
Reviews.Content: So easy to set up and fine tune to your needs.It has a nice sensing range, and you can narrow the sensor by just applying tape.The audio has two settings and if the low setting is to loud, just apply tape over part of the speaker to quiet the sound.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: Desert Dweller "veedeedee"
Reviews.Content: The driveway alarm is absolutely great!  I love being alerted when a vehicle comes down my drive, especially a delivery truck as the delivery men don't always ring the door bell.  A very heavy wind will sometimes set it off, and if the wind last a long time, I just shut off the receiver inside the house.  This is a super product at an excellent price.  Don't know how I lived without it for so long.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Ken B
Reviews.Content: Transmits about 125 ft. to my barn and let's me know if people or cars (or sometimes deer) come up the driveway.  Alert volume is very loud, even on the soft setting, as others have mentioned, but that's OK for what I use it for.  Perfect, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Worked For Store Customer Entrance Monitor
Reviews.Author: Tyson J Dye
Reviews.Content: My business is divided into two parts, an area where customers can shop and a shop where I am creating product.  I needed a way to know when a customer entered and was prepared to run wiring from my front door all the way back to my shop area.When I saw this product at this price I decided to give it a shot. I installed the sensor near the door and set the receiver back on the table where I work.  It has worked perfectly for this and does exactly what I need.I can't say how well it works outside but for this it has been great!

Reviews.Title: ordered 2.....only 1 worked
Reviews.Author: randal harrison
Reviews.Content: ordered 2.....only one worked......defective one not worth the trouble to return......they work great.......when they work.....feel lucky....well, do you punk ?

Reviews.Title: Only worked for three months!!
Reviews.Author: D. L.
Reviews.Content: Only worked for three months until the receiver stopped working; no sound from the receiver.  Prior to it stopping; it was constantly giving out false readings.  I guess I got one of the bad ones.

Reviews.Title: Wireless Alarm Works Amazing
Reviews.Author: Shane Blume
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these driveway alarms. They both work amazing.I set one up inside of my business so as we would be able to hear when someone walks in the door while we are in the back. It does not trigger every time someone walks in front of the sensor, but it works most of the time.The second alarm I setup in the garage to be able to hear if someone walks into the garage, this one also works fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Look good
Reviews.Author: William L. Denham, Jr.
Reviews.Content: I already have one of these sensors working in my driveway and when I saw that the manufacturer was going to stop making them, I thought it would be wise to buy and extra one for the future.

Reviews.Title: Perfect For What I Use If For
Reviews.Author: davglo35
Reviews.Content: I use the driveway patrol at work. I work upstairs on a mezzanine loft. I put the PIR sensor seeing the stairwell and it lets me know when someone is approaching my work area. I have a sit down job and lots of time to read and play on my phone. Both are against the rules but the driveway patrol alerts me before anyone gets to the top of the stairs so ive got time to put my phone away and look bored like im suppose to. My sensor started going off constantly and I hoped it was a sign of a dead battery. Put in a new 9V battery and im back in business. Im sure the driveway patrol has kept me out of trouble with the bosses and I just purchased another one for my driveway at home. I really like the system and the PIR sensor is small and doesnt stick out like a sore thumb. No one even notices it sitting adjacent to the stairwell.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for..
Reviews.Author: Walter George
Reviews.Content: I needed a driveway alarm solution for my property and gave this product a try. I should have known better. For $14, you get what you pay for. Crappy product. I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Product Must Try it!
Reviews.Author: Muhammad Asif
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Product Must Try it! I sent this item back home to my country my younger brother put it in the garage and it saved us once getting our car stolen.

Reviews.Title: Sorry product
Reviews.Author: Patsy Ingle
Reviews.Content: I want my money BACK!!! This item does NOT work!!!!! I can see why they discontinued it!!! Sorely disappointed!!!!!! The sensor tried to work but the receiver will NOT receive!!!SORRY  SORRY product!!!!!! ZERO STARS!!!!

Reviews.Title: Does a great job!
Reviews.Author: Dad
Reviews.Content: When we went to Cali to visit family. We were staying at my Uncle and Aunt's house. They had one of these for their front porch, so they would know if there is someone there. Wife really liked that idea, we have a two story house. When we are upstairs, we can not hear the door bell ring. So I purchased on for that reason, this is actually a great product so far. My only issue is the volume is loud, only gives you two options. Loud and louder! Wish we can lower it a little more. But other then that, it does it's job. We now know when we are upstairs if someone is at our front door.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Donna W.
Reviews.Content: Just what I wanted.  Along with alerting me to vehicles coming up the driveway, it also lets me know when deer are out there.  I'm wondering if the whole thing could be set up in the garden, so the alarm would actually go off in the garden to scare the deer away.  Might try it out one of these days.

Reviews.Title: Works but cheap
Reviews.Author: Technocratic Addict "Shameless geek"
Reviews.Content: Cheapest you can get. Takes C batteries (weird at this point). Extremely bulky for the small circuits inside. I cut mine up and re-wired it but works good. For less than $5 it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great product - Great price
Reviews.Author: Dr. Randall
Reviews.Content: I own two. Very nice, long battery life...4-6 months depending on battery quality. Handles the weather well and seldon goes off without a reason.

Reviews.Title: The Transmission Range Is A Little Optimistic,,,,,,,,,
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: The Transmission Range Is A Little Optimistic,,,,,,,,, The tech writer should use the same measurements I did - and wait until after work to imbibe.  More like 275 feet would be sober and realisticBob Worn, Major,USAF (Retired)1811 Shamburger RoadPritchett, Texas

Reviews.Title: Driveway patrol sensor
Reviews.Author: Bea
Reviews.Content: I gave this to a recently widowed neighbor.  In this hot climate we enjoy leaving our garage doors open and this sensor will easily alert her if someone is entering her garage.  She loves it.

Reviews.Title: Alert sounds drives you crazy
Reviews.Author: Happy Reader
Reviews.Content: This has the most annoying alert sound I have ever heard.  It is not working well for me at all for the purpose it was intended. No way to adjust it, it is in a box with an afghan over it to reduce the volume.

Reviews.Title: to whom it may concern on the Amazon review board
Reviews.Author: Jody O.
Reviews.Content: I guess this is a five-star I like this item very much it hurts me too when the mailman is coming and also lets me know if someone at night is snooping around my house or driveway it works very well thank you very much. Bjwolf

Reviews.Title: Heped us
Reviews.Author: Richard C Martiny
Reviews.Content: We have used these to warn us of unannounced visitors with enough time to take appropriate actions.  It works well.

Reviews.Title: Not bad.
Reviews.Author: King Edward
Reviews.Content: Depending on where it's placed, can have a lot of false alarms. Had to try various positions and lighting to get it where I wanted it.

Reviews.Title: Functional alarm.
Reviews.Author: richard e stetzel
Reviews.Content: I had one of these years ago.  They are really good and last a long time.  I am glad to have it.

Reviews.Title: junk.
Reviews.Author: Robert R Ross
Reviews.Content: Because I couldn't give it no stars. Absolute junk. Goes off when nothing around, and won't pick up a UPS van. TotalWaste of money. Do not buy.

Reviews.Title: USELESS
Reviews.Author: mickey ardoin
Reviews.Content: This product is useless  it keeps going off by itself. I had two of them and they did the same thing.  useless

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: menagirl "dj"
Reviews.Content: using it inside door to alert us of customers entering business. Since it has 400' sensor, it picks up reflections and outside movement. This may be solved by putting shield one side to limit laser to those walking through laser

Reviews.Title: gate
Reviews.Author: sabrina
Reviews.Content: didnt work very long quit working after 2 months would suggest if putting outside make sure in a place good due to weather

Reviews.Title: Once Good, Twice CRAP
Reviews.Author: BatMan
Reviews.Content: I bought this item twice.The First time, Fall 2011.Now That was a Great item. i used it as a Cat doorbell. it worked great.5 STARS.Unfortunately, i never protected the sensor from the elements.So, two years later, it finally dies. the sensor would beep/chime All day for NO reason.No problem. i will buy it again (and be for careful).The Second unit was identical to the 1st, but the packaging was Updated.Instead of coming in a Box, it came in that hard-to-open-HARD-PLASTIC crap we all hate.It also had a label on it "As Seen on TV".Performance: CRAP.it would do the random/constant chiming slash beeping.VERY Annoying. I threw it out in 5 days.1 STAR!No LONGER recommended.

Reviews.Title: Hit or miss
Reviews.Author: Morty
Reviews.Content: Says will detect up to 30 feet, but sometimes doesn't detect at 5 feet. I use it to detect if there's a car coming down my driveway sometimes it works sometimes it doesn't!

Reviews.Title: Great buy, I'm going to order 12 more for ppl who have seen it in action
Reviews.Author: COY RAMIREZ
Reviews.Content: This is a great buy, I use this daily in my field of work and love it. I have had several people ask me to order one for them

Reviews.Title: defective
Reviews.Author: bonnie perkins
Reviews.Content: It doesn't work. I tried new batteries and it won't pick up anything going past it. I moved it within 50 feet of the chime it still doesn't work. If it makes a noise which is maybe once a week there isn't anything there. I am really disappointed with it.

Reviews.Title: Working great.
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Thompson
Reviews.Content: Once again I was doubtful of a inexpensive solution and it's range wireless. But so far so good working great. It has suffered through 50 below temps. this winter and still works. And it only took minutes to set up.

Reviews.Title: I would like to patrol my house with a sensor device
Reviews.Author: Joseph P.
Reviews.Content: I thought that it will work for my application. I used and it is working. I recommend this to other people.

Reviews.Title: Driveway Patrol Sensor
Reviews.Author: Constance George
Reviews.Content: Still trying to get it to work consistently. Small animals set it off but not cars. No directions came with the package other than one sentence on the box. Is this why it was discontinued? The sensor is set 300 feet apart as required. No obstructions are in the way and still car go by unnoticed by the sensor. Sometimes the weather sets it off.

Reviews.Title: Piece of s***.
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: (1) inconsistent ability to detect motion.(2) 9 v. battery in transmitter dies frequently.(3) annoying chime sound.Buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Constantly Falsed
Reviews.Author: Joshua P.
Reviews.Content: I got it for our 50-100 yard driveway to maybe give me a little bit of a heads up if a person or a car was pulling up.  First day I installed it, it was constantly falsing.  There wasn't any wind to speak of.  No birds were around.  After about the tenth time of false alarms, I went out to reposition it...nope.  Falsed again and after the third position I just took the battery out and placed it somewhere visible and hoped it would serve as a visual deterrent to potential burglars.  Thats about the only use I could think of for this crap.  I guess you get what you pay for in this case.  I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Patrol Sensor
Reviews.Author: K.M.Sweezey
Reviews.Content: Works well except after a rain.  Then it works after it dries out a bit. That's all I have to say.

Reviews.Title: This really works great!
Reviews.Author: Helen
Reviews.Content: i purchased this because my dog was doing his business at night while i slept. so i put this in my bedroom and when my dog gets down it kicks off the sensor and i caught him.  he has only gotten down twice and i have caught him every time and has not even tried since then. shipping was fast and is a nice devise that i have re-purposed into a dog training tool

Reviews.Title: Lovr it
Reviews.Author: Tella Smith
Reviews.Content: Love it . I live in rural  area and highly recomend it. It tells when anyone comes by sometimes it goes off even from the street which is quite a ways from from my home .

Reviews.Title: Driveway Patrol Sensor and Receiver Kit (Discontinued by Manufacturer
Reviews.Author: RODERICK MCBRIDE
Reviews.Content: I HAVE BEEN USING THIS PRODUCT FOR OVER TWO YEARS.I  FIND THIS PRODUCT VERY RELIABLE.Driveway Patrol Sensor and Receiver Kit (Discontinued by Manufacturer

Reviews.Title: Great Product Easy to use.
Reviews.Author: D. Baltezore "dbalt"
Reviews.Content: This is a great devise to alert you of someone entering your property. We use it all of the time.Great purchase experience.

Reviews.Title: Telebrands Driveway Patrol Sensor and Receiver Kit (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
Reviews.Author: Y. Goodman "Izzy Goodman"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to put on my front porch so I can hear when deliveries are coming. Often the drivers would leave stuff on the porch and not ring the bell. After some deliveries disappeared, I wanted to be notified when someone approaches my porch. First, they claim a 400 foot range. It is barely 30 feet. It could not reach my downstairs office so I had to put the alarm portion in the hallway. Okay, not the end of the world. Next, when first set up, it was way too sensitive. It kept going off even when someone passed by on the sidewalk. I put tape along the sides of the sensor, adjusted the position numerous times and eventually found a point where the false alarms were few. The problem is it seems to take a full second or two to register motion. Someone just passing in front of it often doesnt set off the alarm. So I faced it down my walkway where someone would walk straight toward it. That finally worked for about a week. Then, either because of cold weather or the battery becoming weaker, it reached the point where you have to dance two feet in front of it before it would go off. If you plan on using this as security to set off an alarm when someone breaks into your garage, you will have to change the 9 volt battery every two weeks and put up a notice to the burglar to stand directly in front of it.

Reviews.Title: Heed the distance limits.
Reviews.Author: dollysods
Reviews.Content: We tried to stretch the labeled distance between the sensor and receiver and that did not work.  Plan on installing it less than the advertised distance and have good clear sight distance between the two. Otherwise a good value.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive and worth the price.
Reviews.Author: Marianna Jones
Reviews.Content: I've had someone messing around my place and can't catch them while they are here.  I got this for peace of mind while I'm in bed sleeping.  So far it's gone off a few times in the middle of the night, I turn on the outside light and look around.  I don't have as much trouble with anyone coming around in the middle of the night any more.It covers a wide range and I know when anyone is here as soon as they are half way up my driveway.  Sure there are a few false alarms, deer most likely, but in the long run, it's worth the small price it costs and has been reliable for the last 4 months during rain, snow and ice.  Will be purchasing more for family.

Reviews.Title: poor transmission quality
Reviews.Author: Delmar Bergen
Reviews.Content: I rated the system less than satisfactory because the transmitter acts as if it required the in home receiver to be line of sight.  That does not help me.  Is something available that would allow me to keep the receiver in my bedroom at night.  This would only be a distance of 120 feet or less but would require the signal to go through a brick wall.

Reviews.Title: driveway patrol
Reviews.Author: Jane catanzaro
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set up and use. Works exactly the way it's supposed to. I have had no false alarms.

Reviews.Title: Use this daily
Reviews.Author: Melanie J Loeb
Reviews.Content: I love this.  I run a home daycare and my parents come in the back door and down the steps into the basement where I run my businesses.  I am never able to tell when parents are coming and going.  I set this on a shelf and now when the back door opens, the sound goes off.  I feel so much more safe knowing that I am aware of when the back door gets opened.  With daycare children here I am so much more cautious of "strangers" and who/how people are entering my home.  This is just some added security and you can't beat that - esp with the price.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: WORKS GREAT
Reviews.Author: Harry  Klein
Reviews.Content: I PURCHASED FIVE OF THESE FOR MY FAMILY MEMBERS FOR X-MAS , THEY ALL LOVE THEM...THE BATTERIES HAVE LASTED FOR 2MO. AND STILL GOING STRONG.

Reviews.Title: Driveway Patrol
Reviews.Author: D
Reviews.Content: I love the Driveway Patrol Sensor. It's  nice to have an "alert" sound when a vehicle pulls up in the driveway.

Reviews.Title: This works most of the time.
Reviews.Author: Bunny Garst
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, this does not always work which is a major problem.  I have to know when someone is entering my gate. When it does work, it is great.

Reviews.Title: Great driveway monitor!
Reviews.Author: umpmod17
Reviews.Content: Love it. Now I know when people are here using our multi-use garage. Glad I ordered it. Get yours today.

Reviews.Title: Bought another
Reviews.Author: acii
Reviews.Content: Very handy and reliable so far.I'd like to cut the sound volume down to about 10%, but that's just me.I see it's now discontinued.Hope they develop a new model with the above suggestion as an option.

Reviews.Title: Not great in all weather
Reviews.Author: Michelle Richardson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift and after being installed it kept going off for no reason when the weather was too cold.  Had to take it down.  Not really good

Reviews.Title: Great sale price and very functional
Reviews.Author: Leland Darryl Armstrong "Behavioral Public Re...
Reviews.Content: We use driveway alarms not just on our driveways but as alarms around the property. We needed one for the cabin entrance area and this one works just fine.

Reviews.Title: Worked great for 3-4 months..
Reviews.Author: R. Melgoza
Reviews.Content: I guess it served its purpose at the beginning but just wished it lasted longer!! 3-4 months and then it started giving false alarms or no alerts at all. You get what you pay for is the bottom line!

Reviews.Title: Patrol Sensor
Reviews.Author: Sarita Floyd
Reviews.Content: Good product to help notify insiders to people or animals outside.  I would recommend this product to others who want to know when someone or something is outside.

Reviews.Title: Great idea
Reviews.Author: Aluxa
Reviews.Content: It worked really well for a month or two.  So well that I bought a second one.  The first one now has already died and now seeing that the item is discontinued by the manufacturer, I'm guessing the second one isn't made to last, either.  Too bad because it's a great idea.

Reviews.Title: weak
Reviews.Author: jdg
Reviews.Content: I have owned two of these. Sometimes they are too sensitive, sometimes not enough... And both of them stopped working... The second one after just a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: Excellant
Reviews.Author: PAUL G. BEMESDERFER JR.
Reviews.Content: I try to buy everything I can on Amazon I am never disappointed this is what I was looking for and I 100% pleased.

Reviews.Title: The Best Trepasser Deterent
Reviews.Author: Alvin Wong
Reviews.Content: I like it was wireless, but hate to keep changing the batteries.Great item for the price.Great security aid to trip up the unwanted trespassers.

Reviews.Title: works very good
Reviews.Author: Gerald Crofutt
Reviews.Content: I can't seem my driveway, so have no idea when someone pulls up.  Better if you face it towards the house.

Reviews.Title: inexpensive motion detector
Reviews.Author: 1Pilgrim "1Pilgrim"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this without researching to thoroughly. Seems moot to review a product that's been discontinued but here goes. Works almost too well. Picks up my tiny terriers wrestling outside door. Also, note: requires 3 C batteries. Who uses C batteries nowadays? And one 9-volt battery--though it does have plug for convertor (not included). If you install good batteries, it will cost more for the batteries than the unit. 15 dollars for me to get it power. In fairness, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: CarpenterJam#1
Reviews.Content: These things can be irritating at times but they surely work. Doesn`t matter how many of them you get so you can get every angle you want. I have three and they don`t counter-act with each other at all. One of them goes of a lil to much and i`m beginning to believe it`s a reflection of of a chime my mother has on the porch, I will stop that soon, lol.

Reviews.Title: Works Exactly As Intended
Reviews.Author: b carney
Reviews.Content: I use this to alert me when someone comes to my door and it works flawlessly.I am using it inside a dual entrance and i do not get any shadows or false triggers.

Reviews.Title: More than for the driveway
Reviews.Author: Annie
Reviews.Content: I purchased the sensor to alert me when my mother wandered at night. I put it at the bottom of the stairs and the receiver with me in the basement. The reception is wonderful. Highly recommend. The Only complaint I have is that I would love a plug for receiver.

Reviews.Title: Intermittant at best. Save your money for a better model.
Reviews.Author: Joel Mercer
Reviews.Content: This thing is terrible. It only works when it wants to, it is totally random and therefore, useless. Better off burning your money.

Reviews.Title: I like the Driveway Patrol Sensor.
Reviews.Author: Jerry Johnson
Reviews.Content: Driveway Patrol Sensor works well for me. For it to work well, it cannot be position near trees or shrubs because the wind will set alarm off.

Reviews.Title: Works ok.
Reviews.Author: Trent T.
Reviews.Content: I like it but it is a little erratic. Doesn't always go off. I have walked in front of it a bunch of times in a row to test it and sometimes it will not sense me and other times it will even though I pass by it exactly the same way each time. I'd say for the price it is a good purchase but don't leave a basket of expensive jewellery sitting out thinking this will prevent a robbery.  ;)

Reviews.Title: Driveway patrol sensor
Reviews.Author: Ella Janis
Reviews.Content: They actually don't work some issue with the wires.  Did not use right away and it had been awhile since I bought them but none of them work.

Reviews.Title: Great Unit.  Batteries Last
Reviews.Author: Dave Anonymous
Reviews.Content: This unit is works great.  As with all sensors of this type, it will detect moving branches and at times temperature changes caused by sun shine.  This can be minimized by placing tape over the sensor to lesson what the sensor detects.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Cutie
Reviews.Content: I place one in the front and the back of my home and they detect everything from pets to the sunrise.  I love that it scares the pets off and I don't have to wonder when the postal carrier has come.

Reviews.Title: falso alarms
Reviews.Author: Carol Harper
Reviews.Content: The unit works very well, however, many false alarms.  Would order another in a future date if needed.  Very useful.

Reviews.Title: Installation a little tricky
Reviews.Author: Artique Consignments
Reviews.Content: This patrol sensor had to have the beam placed at a certain height.  My driveway did not have any structure of that height that I could attach it to.  I had to create a make shift post.  Then after about two weeks the alarm sound became very low even with new batteries. Great fast delivery.

Reviews.Title: Two hours of service, then nothing
Reviews.Author: CowboyMan "MLF"
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed.  I put in the required batteries in both units , tested for movement and signal, and everything worked just fine. I put the PIR down the driveway about 60ft from my front door, and tested again.  Great.  Two hours later, my wife came back from her walk, and 'no alert' from the receiver when she passed the PIR.  I went out to check the PIR and brought I back closer to the receiver.  I made motions over the PIR and still, nothing from the receiver.  The PIRs indicator light is blinking, but I can't get any reaction at all from the receiver.  I swapped out the batteries, nothing.  I don't have an ac power adapter for it, so can't try it that way.  I've just ordered another kit (same as this, and yes, I'm mentally disturbed),  this time, however, with the recommended power adapter.  If it works with the adapter I'll keep it, but will be looking for a refund if the receiver doesn't wake up.

Reviews.Title: Simple & easy
Reviews.Author: Brian Rogers
Reviews.Content: Just as advertised.  Put the batteries in, aim the sensor and viola, it connects.  In this installation the sensor is ~200' away through trees and the wall of the house, and still there is no problem.  Wish that it came with a power supply to start, rather than adding one later.

Reviews.Title: Works average at best
Reviews.Author: Rudy
Reviews.Content: Works sometimes.  Either too sensitive or not sensitive enough.  Very inexpensive, you get what you pay for. I'd pass on this.

Reviews.Title: Really alerts you...
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Evensen
Reviews.Content: I am fairly pleased with this item, but a little concerned about the over sensitivity & false alarms...probably due to the wind and flying debris.I don't know but am clearly alerted when it goes off. I would like a variable volume switch instead of just high and low. Even on low it's too loud. If you're hard of hearing this would be great for you!

Reviews.Title: unuseable
Reviews.Author: Zed "zed"
Reviews.Content: Constantly goes off with the slightest wind - or temp change due to wind currents - finally had to put it on a shelf b4 throwing it away

Reviews.Title: easy set up
Reviews.Author: snowbound
Reviews.Content: This is working well in my driveway. Easy to set up and the chime is loud enough to hear if we are on another floor of the house.

Reviews.Title: Driveway Patrol Sensor and Receiver Kit
Reviews.Author: Average Guy
Reviews.Content: This is a great product and makes great alarm for anyone outside your yard or your area.  Great price too!  Thank you very much!

Reviews.Title: Works TOO well
Reviews.Author: baabaa
Reviews.Content: We use this at our mechanic shop to alert us to customers.
