Oh, the alarm light on the sensor lights up when you move in front of it, but the receiver never sounds the alert.  Mounted everywhere from ground level to 5 feet high and from right outside the window to 20' 50' and 100' with same result.  Piece of UNRELIABLE crap.

Reviews.Title: I HAVE 3 SENSORS AND I LOVE THEM!
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann Tremmel
Reviews.Content: Three years ago I had some Halloween decorations stolen from the front lawn in the middle of he night. I purchased 3 Driveway Patrol Sensors to scatter around the front yard. They are all placed inside things- one's in a birdhouse, one is inside a halloween decoration and the other in a feeder.  They are all mounted so that they will not move (from the wind or rain or small animal). Any type of movement will set them off. They are also not pointed at trees, because moving branches and leaves will set them off as well. They have a wide range, so you have to be sure they are not pointed at oncoming vehicles, because car lights at night will also set them off. After I figured all this out, I placed them where I thought they would only pick up someone walking through the yard-and they have worked perfectly since. Two sensors will work with one receiver, but I cannot get all three to work with only one receiver.  I think they are great with proper placement!!

Reviews.Title: Richard D
Reviews.Author: Richard D.
Reviews.Content: Although I do feel this item would be effective in some situations such as areas where there is nothing like animals ,trees, nearby traffic, that would set it off unfortunately my situation wasn`t a good one for this motion detector and I did go ahead and buy a under ground "Mighty Mule" system that has worked great for my situation.

Reviews.Title: worked great for only 27 days
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: I use this INSIDE ONLY, for a pet. When she goes to the back door and wants out it should go off so no matter where I am at in the house, I can let her out when the alarm goes off.  Worked great for 27 days and now it goes off even when no one is near the sensor or it doesnt go off at all.

Reviews.Title: this sensor stopped working after two months
Reviews.Author: Lovejoy "tr"
Reviews.Content: This sensor stopped working after two months and since it is past the return policy date I can only gethalf my money back and I have to pay return shipping. Warning this product is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: BETTER THAN THE HIGHER PRICED MODEL THAT IT REPLACED
Reviews.Author: wizard
Reviews.Content: WAS PLEASANTLY SURPRISED THAT THIS LESS EXPENSIVE DETECTOR WORKED THAN THE OLD ONE THAT I HAD FOR ABOUT 4 YEARS... ALL THE REVUES WERE RIGHT ON...

Reviews.Title: works when it wants to
Reviews.Author: Curtis B. Wade "brent wade"
Reviews.Content: this thing is driving me nuts, the instructions that came with it were just about putting batterys in not about how to place units sucks

Reviews.Title: goes off all the time finally shut it off stay away
Reviews.Author: William R. Hiatt
Reviews.Content: goes off all the time even after adjusting about ten different times stay away...not worth the money at any price

Reviews.Title: Good product if it works
Reviews.Author: ELF
Reviews.Content: We ordered two of these to detect wildlife in the garden.  One worked, one did not work.  Looks like a 50-50 proposition.  You may need to order two of them to get one working unit.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work sensor never stops activating
Reviews.Author: your mom
Reviews.Content: Bought this to give me a heads up when someone drove or walked into my driveway. It does work however the sensor seems a bit too sensitive. It is either picking up on the small trees blowing in the wind in my neighbors yards or it is picking up on the cars that drive by, because the bell goes off every 15 minutes during the day until about 6 PM. After that it works whenever someone walks through the driveway or drives up.Not sure if there is a way to adjust the sensor I'll continue to try and move it around until whatever is causing it to go off so often is no longer in the sight of the sensor but until then I'll have to stick with the 3 star review because frankly I can't turn it on until after 6 and expect it to work right.Update: Can't get it the sensor to work properly. So it is useless. Don't waste your money on this product. It goes off even in a room where nothing is moving. This needs to be pulled off of amazon.

Reviews.Title: Does the job
Reviews.Author: D G "USA"
Reviews.Content: Have this setup in a garage and pointed inwards towards a wall and placed in a open shoebox knee high amongst the clutter to hide it.  So far it is 100% effective and no false alarms at all.  Tested daily and does go off when in direct open path of the box.  Have not tested without the box since it does appear to focus any motion in line of sight.

Reviews.Title: NEVER BUY AGAIN
Reviews.Author: PORTLY PICKLE
Reviews.Content: Sometimes they work and other times they dont.But you can expect them to work just fine when there is nothing there to set it off.Spend a little more for something else.....Also Volume button has no detent to know when its loud or soft but if in between you'll get nothing.

Reviews.Title: Driveway Patrol Kit
Reviews.Author: Ken Edwards
Reviews.Content: The Item is exactly what I wanted. It is a little sensitive to wind blowing plants, but once I trimmed the plants a little it works as desired.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product.
Reviews.Author: DS
Reviews.Content: This sensor worked for what I needed. Bought two of them and each sensor will send a signal to both receivers which works well for my purposes. It is somewhat sensitive to movement other than large objects, but would rather have a false positive, than a failure to detect movement.

Reviews.Title: Wireless Patrol
Reviews.Author: Monte J. Christie
Reviews.Content: Works well, sometimes doesn't pick up vehicles even with new batteries.  We live in a very out area and it let's us know that someone is coming.

Reviews.Title: Driveway Patrol Sensor and Receiver Kit
Reviews.Author: Stavros Boinodiris "sxb"
Reviews.Content: The units worked initially well. Yet within a period less than one month the receiver lost its voice. It seems that the alarm speaker was defective. I hope I can get a replacement.

Reviews.Title: Works ok... sometimes.
Reviews.Author: matt151617
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if it's just overly sensitive or it just likes going off at random sometimes.  I first set it up on the side of the house, facing across the driveway.  But every time our neighbor walked to his car, it went off... even 15 feet away through thick cedar bushes.  So I moved it onto a tree facing the house at a 45 degree angle.  Everything seemed to set it off.  So then I put it against the house further up the driveway where it couldn't pick up the neighbor.  It seems to work good for awhile, then for no particular reason it will start going off at 3am one or two times.  It's too high off the ground to pick up small animals; in testing it there, it only goes off for people or vehicles.  Very annoying, we end up shutting it off.

Reviews.Title: DOA
Reviews.Author: Media Enterprises, Inc.
Reviews.Content: Bought one when I was in the middle of a move. It went off continuously but I waited too long to return it. Bought a replacement and it did not work. I do have one that works, so for me it's been one working unit out of three.

Reviews.Title: Worth the price, but you have to make it work for your personal situation.
Reviews.Author: DeTerminator
Reviews.Content: This device really does work, but you have to play with it to learn it's capabilites.  You can't just put it out there expecting it to do what you think it should do.  It picks up on moving shadows that pop up when the sun creates them, and the wind moves them around.  Find out why you get false alarms, if you do.  Know when you should use them, and not just leave it on if you don't need it on.  It's like setting a trap for a critter.I wrecked my first receiver by trying to use a 12 volt AC adapter on it!  Dohhh!  It says to use a 4.5 volt for it.  I ordered another unit, and had two sensors for it then, and that worked out great in my driveway/porch area.  In fact, I'm glad I fried mine and ended up with two sensors. That way I can layer the sensors to cover more area.I love mine, and knowing that people can't pop in unexpectedly.  I like the portability of the receiver with the C batteries, but I may get the 4.5 volt adapter from Radio Shack.  I can sit at my computer, and turn it on if hear a noise without having to get up unnecessarily.  Or, leave it on if I'm in the bathroom, or part of the house where I can't see what's going on outside.

Reviews.Title: NICE ALARM
Reviews.Author: Annette J. Miller
Reviews.Content: Purchased this product to back up my security system.If the electric is out for any period of time I only have 12 hrs withthe installed Home Security system.Picked up my first visitor today,he was not even close to the door.I will have to order these also.Energizer Max Alkaline 9 Volt, 4-CountandDuracell Coppertop Batteries C, 8-CountPlan to buy more driveway patrols  and place them around my home.

Reviews.Title: It works well
Reviews.Author: GP
Reviews.Content: I bought this item thinking it wasnt gonna work but it did and it works very well. I installed it in my driveway so i know if someone is coming and i can get a heads up before they show up on my doorstep. You also have the options of turning off the reciever when you dont want to use it and it has a high and low volume setting but the motion detector cant be turned off you can only unplug the battery and thats the only way to turn that off. Only bug that it has is that when birds fly across it it goes off sometimes and gives you a false alarm but other than that i recommend this product to anyone.

Reviews.Title: NOT HAPPY
Reviews.Author: Dr. Tarzan M.D.
Reviews.Content: ordered two of these .... one came broke ... I'd have to pay to return it and its just not worth my time and effort

Reviews.Title: Sensor Spread = 20-degrees at 30'
Reviews.Author: P. S. Lee "Integrity"
Reviews.Content: Wanted to let it be known that the sensor head range-spread is only 20-degrees wide at 30 feet; that is according to the instruction sheet that came with the unit, and tested by walking in front of it. Haven't seen this information posted anywhere else. I'm no mathematician, but it seems like that might be about 15 - 20 feet wide at 30 feet from the sensor head, and of course wider still the farther out you go. I'd have preferred a wider spread, but I'm sure it's sufficient to cover most driveways -- it is after all named Driveway Patrol! I bought three units because they are very cheap compared to other brands. All three units work well and function as designed. I wish the spread was wider as I use them to cover our entire front yard, but criss-crossing the IR beams works. Also, they sense well beyond 30 feet, so I had to point them downward to avoid alerting on passing cars. I've had two other brands and these work just as well for much less cost. Research IR sensors before buying or their many quirks might disappoint you. Have owned these for just one week, will update when/if they fail. Agree with others, pointable mounting options and an AC adapter would be nice.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Roberta M Mills
Reviews.Content: I have the sensor where I park my car since I have had it broken into and it gives me peace of mind. I needed to put a mock bird house around it because it sensative to leaves blowing, but it works great after I did that.

Reviews.Title: Two units don't work
Reviews.Author: Mike Mcdonald "Trombonist"
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these units since I can't see our driveway from the house, and it worked beautifully, so much so that I decided to buy one for the back of the house, but discovered that they are on the same frequency.  Now when something sets off the front driveway, the back receiver goes off too, and vice versa, so I have no idea which side of the house someone is approaching.  I checked,(by taking the unit apart) and there is no way to change frequencies on the the units.Anybody know a work around for this situation?

Reviews.Title: Driveway Patrol Motion Detectors
Reviews.Author: New Mexico Consumer
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these from Amazon to use at the front door and at one of the back doors.  My intention was to provide advanced warning at night if someone approached the house.  We have a full alarm system but the internal motion detectors are purposely turned when we are in the house and these units were intended to augment that protection.Both motion detectors work well and ring in on both receivers.  The volume is such that only one receiver is necessary.  During the day, I do get some false alarms from the back unit due to where I have it located.  Occasionally I have to turn off the receiver to keep the number of false alarms to a minimum.My units are not directly susceptible to the elements.  They are under cover.Good, solid product.

Reviews.Title: Does what it is supposed to
Reviews.Author: zazblue
Reviews.Content: At first I put the batteries and nothing happened. I was putting it back in the box, a friend came over, told him about it, we read the instructions and noticed they warned you about a lapse of time after you put the batteries in both devices. Warning should be more visual. Once product was working it was just a matter of finding the right place to cover the most area. Very happy with it because it does exactly what it says. Little loud,

Reviews.Title: Works really well
Reviews.Author: Rohan Vazarkar
Reviews.Content: I'm using this as a door alarm for my dog. I tried couple of other products and they didn't work always. This one works very well. Note that it will keep beeping as long as the motion is detected so it can become annoying if you don't get the door right away. I like the feature of two sound levels. I have kept it at a lower decibel.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it
Reviews.Author: Sully "Sully"
Reviews.Content: I ordered two units - they were inexpensive enough and other reviews gave me the gut call that it might just take two to result in one functional set. And that turned out to be the case. One set (sensor plus receiver) appears to work just fine. The other set came without all the parts. Plain as day, the battery connections are simply not installed. Humorously, the "Q.C. Passed" inspection sticker is stuck right where the contacts should be! Blind inspector, maybe?? So - I now have one receiver and two sensors, which I can get by with -- 'cause at $13 a pop, it's not worth the time to return.

Reviews.Title: Works Great!
Reviews.Author: dcooper53
Reviews.Content: This driveway motion sensor works great.  Almost too sensitive since it covers up to 400 feet.  Just be careful where you aim it. LOL  If you aim it toward the street, it will go off any time someone walks by or drives by.  But if you position it properly to bounce off the house or go across the yard, or you have more than a 400 foot area to cover, it's great.  I like them so well, I ended up buying 2 more.

Reviews.Title: Driveway Patrol Sensor
Reviews.Author: Phyllis H. Pajka
Reviews.Content: This sensor works extremely well.  We put it up as soon as it arrived and it's nice to know when someone pulls into our driveway since it is a fairly long one.  At least on one can sneak up on you with this sensor.

Reviews.Title: I expected more
Reviews.Author: oldmill322
Reviews.Content: I purchased this and placed it right next to my driveway and it has not worked very well. It is not sensitive enough and there is no adjustment. Cars drive right by it and it never goes off.

Reviews.Title: Works great in cold weather too!
Reviews.Author: storyboy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this unit two months ago for the sole purpose of letting me know when the cat was ready to come in. I found a used power supply in my junk drawer that eliminated the need for a supply of C batteries as described by another reviewer. Also, following the leads of prior owners, I taped the lense of the alarm to focus on a tight area of the doorstep to cutdown on false alarms and found a container to shield the outside unit from moisture. Thanks to heeding these prior tips, the alarm has worked exactly as I hoped since the day I installed it. Today, the temperature is a solid - 5 degrees BELOW ZERO. Both the cat and I were happy that the unit functioned so well. Even at this extreme temperature he wanted out, he just didn't stay out long. I was greatful that I didn't have to open my outside doors numerous times to let him in.

Reviews.Title: Thought It Would Be OK - Wrong
Reviews.Author: GoodCustomer
Reviews.Content: I originally wrote a positive review, because it seemed that I was getting it set up in working order. I gave it some slack for being cheap against needing a lot of fiddling. I first found that just mounted on a post beside the driveway, it was seeing trucks 300 feet away and alarming. Moved it to the other side where it only sees a fence and pasture. Kept false alarming. I figured tall grass blowing in the wind. I used tape to mask off most of the sensor. Still got false alarms. I could get rid of the false alarms, but only by restricting it so much that it couldn't see the car in the driveway. So I used a pvc pipe coupling as a barrel, so I could leave the sensor more open and restrict the angle of view. Seemed to work. But then, on a foggy night, I couldn't see the car anymore. I have put too much time already into it. I'm returning it.I conclude that it does work, in the sense that it can generate an alarm. It may be fine for something like a closed area where anything intruding at all needs to be detected. A back porch, for instance, although the cats will probably set it off. And it may be that in just the right driveway setup, it could work properly. But I believe those situations are few.

Reviews.Title: false alarms
Reviews.Author: T. Hawes
Reviews.Content: This was good at sending alerts when someone walked by it, but I could not find a way to control the excessive number of false alarms.

Reviews.Title: A great front door monitor
Reviews.Author: Ernie "Engineman (USN)"
Reviews.Content: We use this Sensor to monitor anyone who comes with in 10 feet of the front door. This lets use know before a person even rings the door bell.

Reviews.Title: Driveway Patrol Sensor & Receiver Kit
Reviews.Author: Free4Him
Reviews.Content: The item is malfunctioning after a months use. The receiver comes on and won't stop. I changed the batteries but it didn't help. They say it has been too long to return it. Bought it in November.

Reviews.Title: Skeptic no longer
Reviews.Author: W6WGC
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical at first, but I would give this product a 5 star rating because it performs exactly as advertised.  False alarms seem almost inevitable to me because it is not possible to control everything that may set off the motion sensor.  I have seen more expensive products that perform no better than this one.

Reviews.Title: So So Sensor
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: Works OK most of the timeBUT!!  It get set of by direct sunlightsometims and does not pick up COLD metalfrom vehicles, especially at night

Reviews.Title: Worked nice while it lasted
Reviews.Author: E. Wait "betsymn"
Reviews.Content: Worked nice while it worked, but after a couple of months the alarm part quit working. Changed the batteries with fresh ones, but it still doesn't work.ETA: changed my rating. It started working again. And also, I took the batteries out and plugged it into a power adapter. Works just fine, except when it's really windy. Then there's more false alarms. Definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Driveway Patrol Sensor
Reviews.Author: L Webster "Webster"
Reviews.Content: This driveway patrol sensor works well.  It is very sensitive and as others have suggested, apply obscured tape to reduce the sensitivity.  Also, although the device has an electric connector (in place of batteries) would have been nice if they had offered the adapter for additional charge.  Over all very satisfied with this product.

Reviews.Title: Too Quirky
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: Everything under the sun sets this off.  Wind, a leaf blowing by, rain, snow, who knows what.  I set it up on a light post in my driveway to detect cars coming in and it does that but way too many other false alarms.  I tried taping up half of the lens and still no luck.  I got what I paid for- cheap.  Looking for something more accurate.

Reviews.Title: sentry
Reviews.Author: V. Teachout "grandpa"
Reviews.Content: Works great a little sensitive but tape fixed that lets us know when someone drives or walks in. delivery was fast and on time.

Reviews.Title: Handy for Hunters!!
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: I bought these for my dad who installed them so that he could see when his deer heard was coming in at night.  He was able to see what time they were leaving in the morning too, and was better prepared for opening day!

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the Price
Reviews.Author: networkguru
Reviews.Content: Setup literally takes a minute.  You put batteries in the receiver and the transmitter, put the transmitter where you want, and boom, its working.  The instructions say it may take some tweaking by adding tape to the side of the motion sensor to give you the desired effect without any false alarms.  Some people have said its not good in the sunlight, but it seems fine with me.  I run a bed and breakfast, and like to know when people are driving in to the driveway, so I know when people arrive.  It fits that purpose.  I have it facing away from the road, so I don't get any false alarms from traffic on the road, but since its a wooded area, I do get false alarms when its windy and the trees are blowing.  It has great range, I have the receiver about 250 feet from the transmitter and it works fine.  It doesn't seem to work as well in the morning as it does in the afternoon. I don't know if its because its cold out and the battery isn't performing the way it should, or maybe there is dew on the motion sensor blocking the unit.  All in all, for the price is a good product...I don't have to spend my days staring out the window waiting for guests to arrive.

Reviews.Title: wish I saved my receipt!
Reviews.Author: Jake Anderson
Reviews.Content: In the beginning, the chime worked maybe 40% of the time, and now not at all. I bought this to keep my cat out of a room and a flashing red light with no loud chime does not deter him at all. Waste of money...definately going with another brand next time.

Reviews.Title: economical eye
Reviews.Author: Donatello
Reviews.Content: The item initially seemed to be defective until I discovered the 9 volt battery I used wasn't fresh. After installing a new battery the unit performed as expected. It was used to monitor my recently diagnosed diabetic cat's litter box activity, since shadowing her everyday activity is virtually impossible.It allowed me to get a glucose reading on the spot in order to determine if the insulin dosages were effective. Happily the kitty is now in remission.

Reviews.Title: Super
Reviews.Author: Whit
Reviews.Content: Very sensitive and that's a good thing.  I have a driveway sensor that uses a hose etc, and cost $130.  But, the hose fails and that part cost $44. I plan on buying additional units from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Loud
Reviews.Author: R. Young
Reviews.Content: This monitor is really loud which makes you want to leave it off rather than monitor your yard.  It works great other than the low setting is loud enough to wake the dead.

Reviews.Title: Buying a 2nd one
Reviews.Author: smasty "Sue"
Reviews.Content: I totally love this product and am buying a 2nd one.  Yes..it picks up the dogs running across the street and blowing branches at times, but for the price does what I need it to do.  It's so easy to move the sensor for different jobs.  I use this to monitor traffic on my dark street, I've used it to alert me to deliveries at my door that needed signatures (when I'm in the basement), I'm currently using it to alert me when my psuedo-pet fox arrives at the back door for a treat.  I only need to change the batteries about every 18 months.  I wish I could just buy additional sensors...but can't, so buying a 2nd unit for the sensor.

Reviews.Title: For 15$ item return cost = not worth returning
Reviews.Author: Ishmael
Reviews.Content: Bought unit in July2011, failed in October 2011. For some reason the sensor sends alarm every few seconds. Light blinks and alarm sounds.Worked good for awhile every time someone passed it sent signal to receiver. It is light weight and I would not use it outside. For $14.00 with shipping it is a throw away unit. Return period is very short, you pay to return.Same unit is sold under a lot of names.Driveway Patrol Sensor and Receiver Kit

Reviews.Title: Great item
Reviews.Author: Ronnie_ Trinidad
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item for use outside my home. i live in the Caribbean and the weather conditions verify, but this doesnt affect the sensors. it works great.but follow the instructions, put it at least 3 feet above ground, those darn kittens always setting it off, so i had to raise it.great great item

Reviews.Title: Used to be really good
Reviews.Author: Betty
Reviews.Content: I purchased one of these units about 5 years ago and the thing is still working great! Loved it for notifying me when someone entered my driveway. My son got his own house and asked if he could use it as he didn't have a door bell and no way of knowing if someone pulled in his driveway. Its worked great for him also. Then I bought myself a new one a couple of years ago when my son took mine. The thing seemed to get a constant signal as it just kept going off no matter what I did. Even facing the wall it would just keep sending a constant pulsing signal to the receiver. Since it was cheap I never bothered to send it back. Now I went ahead and purchased 2 more complete set ups. One works great and the second doesn't see motion unless it's with in a few inches of the sensor. Then when it transmits to the receiver it can only get a alarm if the receiver is within a foot of the motion sensor. So it seems to be that the newer ones are running a 50% failure rate. I'm going to try another brand as the idea is a wonderful idea that would be beneficial for setting up in a car at night to alarm for thieves or a out building as well as driveway.

Reviews.Title: It's good and bad
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: Amazon has these at a very great price.  When I got mine and set it up, it worked well, very well, too very very well.  It does what it's suppossed to do but the problem is anything that moves including birds, little animals like dogs or cats, squirrels and even branches moving in the wind will trigger this device.  The key it putting the motion sensor in a place where NONE of the above will send out false positives which is hard to do.

Reviews.Title: Great Product/Service
Reviews.Author: eagleeye1943
Reviews.Content: Delighted to know that multiple sensors can be used with only one receiver.  I now have them all over my house.  One button turns them off during the day. They're accurate and dependable, never fail except driveway unit gives false alarms in heat/direct sunshine but I expected that.  Prompt processing and delivery time.

Reviews.Title: Works Well,imo.
Reviews.Author: R. A. Craft Jr. "AlienC"
Reviews.Content: This item needs a strong 9vot in the detector in order to be it's most sensitive. As it wears down, range is reduced. I'm using rechargeable AA's with a C-style body to keep costs down. This has worked well. I like it, and am buying some more to monitor the back fence line.

Reviews.Title: Driveway patrol
Reviews.Author: Remington
Reviews.Content: For the money, you get what you pay for.  The alarm is pretty loud, I built an enclosure for it.  It works properly 80 percent of the time, haven't figured out why.  I think the battery is low and get ready to change it and it works again?  Baffling.  Like I said, you get what you pay for.  If it goes bad, I will probably get another.

Reviews.Title: some what satisfied
Reviews.Author: Myra H. Henderson "gladys12"
Reviews.Content: It works well, but it's a little to sensitive, everytime a truck goes past my house it constantly goes off, the instructions say put tape along the side of it, if that occured, but it still did'nt do any good!

Reviews.Title: Driveway motion sensor
Reviews.Author: William Jack
Reviews.Content: This product will detect people and cars walking into our driveway.  The Two sound level tone is about as loud as a electronic doorbell chime. The device will also sound if Mourning doves, chipmunks, etc. go past the sensor.  The cure in the instructions is using tape to cover a portion of the sensor. That cure is a little iffy. A separate sensitivity control would be better. Range for people-sized objects is about 25-30 feet.

Reviews.Title: Terrible range in only light brush
Reviews.Author: Will Coffey
Reviews.Content: This thing would not work ten feet in light tree brush.  I had to take an old remote control antenna used for a toy car and wire it up to the base unit, then pull the inner antenna out of the detector through a hole I drilled before hot gluing around it to seal out moisture.  Now it works as advertised.  I gave it two stars because I could at least work with it.  But unless you want to go through what I went through or you just like returning stuff, do not buy.

Reviews.Title: Does the job
Reviews.Author: R. Collins
Reviews.Content: I've used one of these as a driveway alarm in the past and it was a little too sensitive.  Not sure if it was animals running by or trees swaying in the wind.  A few times I'd peek out the window when the alarm sounded, but never saw anyone.  I bought this one recently to use as an alarm for my new garden shed.  It worked perfectly.  The only gripe is that the sensor mounting screw that came with it has a tapered head.  So when you mount the sensor onto the screw head, you can't really press down to lock into place because of the tapered screw head.  So it's just hanging there on the screw, not really secure.  As soon as it was bumped it fell to the floor and stopped working, and something is rattling around inside.... so now I just ordered another one.  I'll use my own screw this time.  The sensor takes 1 9-volt battery, and the chime takes 2 or 3 C batteries (can't remember exactly how many).  The chime has 3 settings:  Off, Low, and High and just has 2 notes; first high, then low... just like a generic wireless doorbell.

Reviews.Title: False Alarms
Reviews.Author: dicky c
Reviews.Content: Great idea, but like some others have said I have had problems with false alarms in the heat.  Seems like an interesting product, but doesn't work to great in the Las Vegas heat.

Reviews.Title: Reliable Device
Reviews.Author: Bulletman
Reviews.Content: This device works exactly as advertised. The sensor is very sensitive and picks up any moving person, car or object within it's range. I have been impressed with the way it works. I have it monitoring the entire front of my house. Nothing gets within range without me knowing about it. EXCELLENT PIECE OF EQUIPMENT!!!

Reviews.Title: Great price, works great!
Reviews.Author: Karen Davis "kld2003"
Reviews.Content: My mother was having someone come up her stairs late at night, ring her doorbell and run away, scaring a 90 year old woman who lives alone. We installed this at the bottom of her stairs. She heard the alarm go off one night, then heard footsteps running away and hasn't had a problem since. Well worth the money for the piece of mind it gives both of us!

Reviews.Title: good protection
Reviews.Author: Irene Hall
Reviews.Content: I always come home late at night and I feel that it's very unsafe. I read the review on this product and decided to give it a try. Very happy that I did. The motion sensor picks up within a good range. I can turn off the light during the day. The best part is I can keep unwanted guest from coming.

Reviews.Title: Use near built in pool......
Reviews.Author: David Davis "Dave"
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these a couple of months ago. For $13 it was well worth it.I got 2 more just last week for $11 each. For the money they work great.I use them across the doorway to the pool,and then the other two acrossthe two exterior doors leading into the pool area. Had one false alarm witha large truck and solved that. Works great even catching our small dog.Very satisfied with the value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Affordable motion sensor
Reviews.Author: farm girl
Reviews.Content: Wanted an affordable way to tell when my kitties were at the back door waiting to come in and I found it.  Set it up at the back door and it lets me know right when they want in.  The transmitter seems to have no problem reaching the receiver placed inside the house through a wall. The receiver also has two volume settings which is nice.  The low setting is actually low enough to not scare my kitties once I let them in. I ordered another to put on my front porch where my tomatoes are.  Hopefully I can catch the critter that keeps digging through the planters they're in. So far, highly recommended, espectially for those looking for a "trainingless" pet door bell.

Reviews.Title: Driveway Patrol Sensor
Reviews.Author: TL
Reviews.Content: I doubt very much if anyone will ever write a bad review about the Driveway Patrol Sensor!!!!  I am 100% satisfied and recommend it to everyone.  TL

Reviews.Title: good package overall
Reviews.Author: Sulman Bhatti
Reviews.Content: nothing like false alarms yet. just got it and tested it. works ok for me. i wanted something in my facility so that i can have a alarm in backroom if i am sitting in backroom and somebody walks in.works perfect for and motion detection range is not 400 feet thats for sure. but i found a good spot to cover the two enterance. and beside i am going to use it inside. so i dont need 400 feet.secondly i wanted a chime rather than alarm and wanted it cheap. so it serves the purpose too. alarm would be too annoying cuz i am going to need it in day time rather than night time. i will give it five stars for obvious reasons of being cheap and doing what it suppose to do.all in all good product.

Reviews.Title: Alerts someone on their way downstairs in my area
Reviews.Author: Pauls ddd3 "Paulsddd3"
Reviews.Content: It works beautiful for having the sensor on the top step and the reciever on my PC desk with me-alerting me at variable tones-someone is on their way down rather then me be taken by surprize.I have another sensor on the front step-alerting me that someone is at the front door where I can't hear them knocking nor pounding the heck out of the door downstairs-enables me to greet my expected guest promptly as they trip the sensor before the door bell or a knock with the reciever chimming as the sensor beam was broken.

Reviews.Title: Caught in the act
Reviews.Author: isaballe
Reviews.Content: We purchased this sensor after installing a CCTV security system. The security system worked great but its constantly beeping due to all the activity in the area.  We installed the Driveway Patrol sensor along the driveway..high enough up so it didn't detect smaller animals and rodents. My husband made a bird house type structure and its been catching "perps" ever since.  We live on the water and moisture hasn't been a problem..possibly because of the little cedar box he put it in.  The box also hides the tiny red light.  By the time the prowler sees the light its too late.I was on my computer at 1am about a month ago and the security system is beeping as usual....then the driveway alarm goes off.  I look up and there are two men in our driveway.  Case closed!  I love this item and am looking for an ac adapter so I don't have to use batteries.Five Stars for this little gem!!

Reviews.Title: Piney Flats Failure
Reviews.Author: mepop
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money.  Many false alarms and lasted only one month.  I changed batteries and it still will not work.  Very, very short life span.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Juan C. De Rada "Soccer crazy"
Reviews.Content: This product does not work at alll.,, I spent 2 hours trying to calibrate and the thing kept beeping whenever.,,

Reviews.Title: works as supposed to
Reviews.Author: IOC000
Reviews.Content: the service (delivery) was very good.  product is sensitive to even small bodies (animals) and I've noticed that there are "pet-proof" models but I wanted this specifically to detect animals - generally visiting at night.  BTW this product is presently offered by Harbor Freight Tools @ 11.99

Reviews.Title: Kitty Likes Quiet
Reviews.Author: streatorx
Reviews.Content: And it probably has many other uses. Set one "eye" under the awning in the front and one in the carport aimed at the door. Attached alarm to inside of screen with Velcro and Quick Grip and set the other in the front window. Both, of course, work off same frequency so both go off if one eye detects motion. Sounds like a carnival early in the morning and late in the evening after neighbor lets her cat out to do its business. Since the areas are still clean after several days (this was a daily thing for that cat), I suspect it doesn't like the alarm. Hopefully, it will go somewhere else that's nice and quiet! Like over at Rover's.Happened to have a couple 9v batteries in the freezer that still work for the eyes. For the alarm, found a couple adapters I'd collected over the years. One is the universal type with adjustable voltage and various connectors that is still available.Not sure how well the detectors "see" to the side so you might consider your aim. You may also need to employ trial & error. May have had a couple false alarms the other day when the wind blew but I couldn't care less as long as I don't see the mark.

Reviews.Title: Really Nice
Reviews.Author: JOEnT
Reviews.Content: Works really nice on our patio area by the pool. The two different tones are nice also. Batteries seem to last pretty good too.

Reviews.Title: Be prepared for many many false alarms!
Reviews.Author: me
Reviews.Content: I purchased 3 of these (like an idiot).  Of all the products I purchased from Amazon, I regret this purchase.  I placed them on my porch, patio, and mailbox.  FYI, the one in the mailbox didn't work as the signal wasn't strong enough to signal the receiver.  I have followed the instructions including the "tape trick" and still get false chimes.  Even placing the sensor in an area that has no movement including wind interference and still receive bogus chimes.  I moved them several times with the same result.  It seems that even sunlight reflection in the afternoon causes them to activate?  These are very unreliable.  They do not have a control to adjust the sensitivity like a motion floodlight, etc.  After hearing the chime so often I became desensitized. I got so aggravated I stopped using them and plan to return!  Ok, time to write more (positive) reviews ;)

Reviews.Title: Driveway Patrol Sensor
Reviews.Author: Four Wheeler "Traxter"
Reviews.Content: This product works fine and it does what it is suppose to do but I would have liked to have had the ability to set the sensitivity on it because of it being to sensitive. The alarm would go off all the time for no apparent reason or because of the wind blowing something in front of it. I would end up having a lot of false alarms and so I stopped using it.

Reviews.Title: loved it!
Reviews.Author: bell
Reviews.Content: It was just like the one I looked at locally for $39.99! It works great. We caught the theif that was breaking into our cars!

Reviews.Title: Irratic
Reviews.Author: kp
Reviews.Content: The item chimes off for no reason.  No trafffic, no one walking by, no car in the driveway...it just starts chiming.  Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good deal for the money
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: I mounted it to the back of my mailbox so I don't pick up street traffic and also know when the mail is delivered. My old one had a very loud volume so put it in a cabinet, and this one has two volume settings on the switch so can mount it in a better central location.It did have a few false alarms maybe due to the cold temp in the 20's so after 5-10 minutes of beeping it's it stopped and now only beeps when people are coming and going.I had one years ago which worked well and this one for the first few days works well so far.If I run into any issues I'll update this.

Reviews.Title: Very Useful
Reviews.Author: Ligh Freak
Reviews.Content: I had no problem with the product being too sensitive like some reviewers had. I hung it at the corner of the hall way to the front door, and it worked every time. The only bad thing about this unit is, it comes with really cheap screws. One of them broke in half while I was drilling it into a wood surface.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: KimK
Reviews.Content: I purchased this because we have some stray cats that come to our back porch, one in particular that I've taken a fancy to, but with winter here we never know when he's out so we've installed this so we can check when it goes off. Not only do we have him, but at least three to four other strays who we're apparently feeding. It has also let us know that we have birds who enjoy eating the cat food and when the bowl is utterly wiped clean it's either the raccoon, the possum or we've been Rufus'd! Rufus is a neighbors dog who wanders from time to time and apparently he loves cat food as well.I'd recommend this product to anyone that wants to be alerted to someone entering a certain part of their property, back porch, etc. My only con to it would be that I wish you could turn down the number of ding dongs but we do plan on buying a few more of these for other locations on the property.

Reviews.Title: Works great but...
Reviews.Author: Monstaar
Reviews.Content: Works great but it "ding dongs" THREE times when the sensor is activated. One would be sufficient.And the "low" volume setting is still pretty loud.But otherwise it works great.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Michael Chen
Reviews.Content: This is a great product and it works as expected.It is very sensitive and you should aim the sensorto the right direction to avoid false detection.I will buy more for different area outside my house.

Reviews.Title: Works well enough
Reviews.Author: Mark Cammon
Reviews.Content: The sensors have been out in the hot Arizona sun, cool nights (well, for Arizona, down to about 46), heavy rain, and still work great. It didn't take too much time to set them up and test them, either. These are definitely a low budget way to set up a security system so that you'll know if anyone enters your yard but you get what you pay for but still not bad. If you take the time to adjust  the placement of the sensor through some trial and error, this works great! I don't know if the people who complain about these got defective units or have a lot of coyotes or something setting them off, but I have several of these set up to form a perimeter around the house and they work great. We do have cats around here, a whole bunch of them, but the trick of putting the sensors up on poles or bush branches, and I haven't had any false alarms since I finally got them set up.

Reviews.Title: average at best
Reviews.Author: karebro
Reviews.Content: I found the units to be hyper-sensitive at first and then in less than 30 days, 1 of the 2 units stopped functioning all together.  Not worth the postage I would have to pay to return the unit for replacement.  Lesson learned..."as seen on TV" is only seen functioning for :30 or less.  With that as the standard - it worked.

Reviews.Title: Works Well, Easy Setup
Reviews.Author: G. Troutman
Reviews.Content: Installed on the side of parents' carport to cover their back door. With a little duct tape on the sensor I blocked out pet traffic zones and side to side motion areas. It works pretty well except for a real problem with sun/shade changes. Aimed at a brick wall it kept triggering until I figured out the change in heat on the wall from cloud movement was the problem. Had to place it so the sensor viewing area was in constant shade.

Reviews.Title: This is worth exactly what was paid for
Reviews.Author: James H. Kahr "flajim"
Reviews.Content: This alarm works well within the parameters of the manufacturer except the distance of transmission between the sensor and receiver. Placed within 30ft of one another they work just fine.

Reviews.Title: Works, it does, really !!!
Reviews.Author: eric-n-tari
Reviews.Content: Ok, only if you have two of them. Meaning that if you have a two car gargage lets say. The best way to place them is out of reach at each end facing a 45 degree angle or pointing dirctly to the center of your drive way so that it forms sorta like a X. Whats good or great about this is that you get a double alarm. Meaning that if you hear it go off once (beep x4) its probly your cat, if it goes off twice (beep x8) be syspecious, and look if your not doing anything by if you hear it go off 3 times (beep x12) its some one and get your bat because its really happing.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Harry Barney "Binkey Barney"
Reviews.Content: Works great. Squirrels trigger it but that's o.k. Only had it a few days. A bit more time will tell.

Reviews.Title: False Alarms
Reviews.Author: C. Arnold
Reviews.Content: It is great and does a good job.  The only thing is that I can't use it because my neighbor 2 houses down has one and his and mine goes off together.  No matter if the motion is at my house or his all of them go off at the same time.  Driving us crazy so had to take the batteries out of mine.  Is there any way to lower the receiver distance?

Reviews.Title: good buy..
Reviews.Author: DONALD M SALAZAR
Reviews.Content: this product is a good buy....i took some reviewers  advice  and  shielded it a bit  from the sun and rain  ..and  yes  i get a few  false alarms  but not many.....sometimes  even a  shadow will set it off....tolorable  in my book.....i made  a  rain cap for it...to protect it from rain......i use the low volume...[never tried the hi]id  give a  4.5  if  there  what a  1/2 stari do turn it off...if  i'm gonna  be in the area  myself  going  back and forth.....in front of ityes i would recommend it...aside from  the fact that the seller does  NOT  package it whatsoeverit  comes  naked......w/ a shipping label  of course

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Deivis A. Pena Mota
Reviews.Content: It's very good. Very stable. Recommend its use. Has a visibly acceptable quality compared to the price, the better. Thanks

Reviews.Title: Not Great
Reviews.Author: Thomas A. Danella
Reviews.Content: Not that great of an item. It goes off all the time. I have to turn it off at night, before i go to bed. I wouldn't buy another..

Reviews.Title: peace at night
Reviews.Author: D. R. Richardson
Reviews.Content: Got this because of all the brake ins gives a warning so I can get on high alert for battle . Good for in the house not to much for the cost about 23.00 dollars until I buy a better system. See you when it ringssss.

Reviews.Title: this item is pretty good so far
Reviews.Author: R. Gaither
Reviews.Content: This seems to work about 80% of the time.  We are experiencing extremely cold weather, single digits so we will see how it works when the weather gets better.  I put the unit in a small bird house to protect it from the weather and that stopped the false alarms but it seems to not alert about 20% of the time when a car or truck enters the drive.  But for the money this is a great value... you can spend $70 + on these devices.

Reviews.Title: low quality
Reviews.Author: Jason Mahowald "Jason"
Reviews.Content: price isn't bad..didn't like the color because i use this at nightand the white color sticks out like a sore thumb...i ended up putting black tape allover it for concealment..works most of the time.. but fast moving vehicles will sometimesget by it without triggering the alarm

Reviews.Title: Constant False Alarms
Reviews.Author: Steven C. Riley
Reviews.Content: Great idea, but very poor quality.  The constant false alarms make it useless.  I installed it 3' off the ground, out of direct sunlight.  Right now, I have it on my desk, pointing at a wall 1 FOOT away and it is still continuously going off.Piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: worth the money
Reviews.Author: Glen G. skrent "Gdog"
Reviews.Content: because it was so cheaply priced it was worth the money. HOwever, no matter how i set it up it still give false alarms, which are very annoying.  People around here are using them to scare away deer from the garden, not sure if that is working or not. they put the alarm sensor and the alarm at the garden.

Reviews.Title: Driveway Patrol Sensor and Receiver Kit
Reviews.Author: Raymond Y. Richardson
Reviews.Content: It's an okay product but it would have been better if it had a ac adapter that came with it.

Reviews.Title: wasn't what I wanted
Reviews.Author: GB "GB"
Reviews.Content: it only had a chime no alarm. But they were nice when I sent it back...the description was pretty vague...

Reviews.Title: Don't recommend for most applications
Reviews.Author: Eric W. Ericson "Vette man"
Reviews.Content: Too many false alarms. I live in the country and it goes off too often.  Birds will set it off.  Would be fine in places that are not open to any traffic but only a visitor or prowler.  Hard to find a good location.I don't recommend.

Reviews.Title: Alarms so often that it is worthless
Reviews.Author: Meredith P. Wagner
Reviews.Content: Followed the directions but the alarm goes off every few minutes for no obvious reason which makes it truly worthless.  There is obvious demand for a product that does what this item and other more expensive items claim but they all seem to have significant faults.  Where have all of the American inventors gone? Perhaps someone in China is reading this and will design a better product since they make everything that is sold in this country anyway.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: James M. Mulvihill "jim m"
Reviews.Content: Very sensitive.Mounted it in a birdhouse to protect it from the elements, as suggested by a previous reviewer..With the sensor's view out the entry hole, it was still too sensitive for the location that I placed it. Placed a piece of duct tape over the top half of the hole...perfect!Passing birds still give the occasional false signal.

Reviews.Title: Works as expected
Reviews.Author: Longhorn "Mike"
Reviews.Content: The item works just as expected.  I use the sensor inside of my house and have not had any false alarm issues.  I highly recommended the product at a price of under $20.

Reviews.Title: Not 100% sure
Reviews.Author: Donna Cansdale
Reviews.Content: Driveway Patrol Sensor and Receiver KitCheap and easy to install,but sometimes does not sound chime. Have changed positions several times to see if that made a difference and so far, it hasn't. Would prefer a harder to install alert that is 100% reliable.

Reviews.Title: Good wind detector
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Wino"
Reviews.Content: The Driveway Patrol has a serious problems with false alarms. I have enclosed it in a bird house to protect it from the sun but every breeze sets off the alarm.  My motion sensor lights include technology that prevents false triggering by wind.  I suggest that the manufacturer incorporate this feature and they would have a real winner.

Reviews.Title: Driveway Patrol
Reviews.Author: Sandra Greenman "precarious idiot"
Reviews.Content: This product is very sensitive.  It goes off w/o reason.  We have taped all but the center off and it still goes off when the wind blows the tress in the yard.  However, it does let us know when UPS has sneakly left a package.

Reviews.Title: It really works!
Reviews.Author: J. Ewoldt "timber rancher"
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical but this motion detector really works well. I have a lot of trees along my driveway so I do get a few false alarms when it's real windy. So I need to either relocate the sensor or trim tree branches. Otherwise I've had no problem and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: not pleased
Reviews.Author: Dale Ketcham "We Board Labs, Inc."
Reviews.Content: Seemed to work for a while, then it was beeping a lot and I'd look out my window and could not tell what has set it off.  Then I'd watch a car arrive or leave and the darn thing wouldn't detect a car!  I finally gave up and disconnected it.

Reviews.Title: review of driveway sensor
Reviews.Author: R. Simmons
Reviews.Content: I use it as a door sensor in my shop.  It is not consistant, often I have people waiting at the counter without the sensor letting me know they came in.  Works about 80% of the time.

Reviews.Title: Happy Customer
Reviews.Author: Gerald W. Holder
Reviews.Content: Excellent Product!  Received early.  Don't stop selling this item.  It is sensitive as described to intruders and well made.  Thanks for the great service!!

Reviews.Title: Works great with adjustments
Reviews.Author: Sandeep Nema
Reviews.Content: It works great when adjusted for the best location. It senses almost 30 feet lengthwise, so make sure you do not cover the walkway to avoid chimes for every pedestrian. I have put it diagonally to cross over the driveway and the front door path. You may have to do little work before you can figure the best location.

Reviews.Title: For the money you cant go wrong
Reviews.Author: Thomas P. Mchugh
Reviews.Content: I used this devide to track the coming and going of a skunk from under my front porch.  I tried to trap the critter for weeks, but with the sensor I was able to confidently seal off the passage way he dug, preventing the return of the anmimal.  I now utilize the sensor to tell me when I have someone at my door until such time as I can get the doorbell fixed.  I am most pleased with the utility and value of this item.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with product
Reviews.Author: H. Glasser
Reviews.Content: Pleased with product - thank you. Prior effort to review purchase on Amazon did not work correctly.

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed for alert me when someone gets close to my driveway or anywhere you need warning alert A+A+A+
Reviews.Author: Jose L. Alvarez
Reviews.Content: Just what I needed for alert me when someone gets close to my driveway or anywhere you need warning alert A+A+A+

Reviews.Title: Great service
Reviews.Author: Ronnie T. Harris
Reviews.Content: Unit arrived with a problem in the receiving unit.  They immediately replaced it to my satisfaction.  Great customer service using email.  Totally satisfied with the product.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price.
Reviews.Author: Clem Kiddlehopper "Wild Idaho"
Reviews.Content: This is a great solution to let us know when someone is coming down our long driveway. Set up was easy and works well. We did have to place it about 4 feet off the ground to keep the wildlife in our area from registering. Great product for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Rusted Nut Garage
Reviews.Content: There is good and bad news to report.First the good news.It works.It is inexpensive.Simple to set up.Now for the bad newsUnless you have direct line of sight expect the range to be around 100 feetMy sensor had a null in the middle and was much more sensitive on the sides.My best guess is that this unit at $11.50 probably did not pass all the factory tests.  After reading the reviews I elected to construct a small bird house for the sensor to reside in.  This was to hide the sensor and protect it from the Northwest Rain.  Once it was mounted in the appropriate area I found that the Cedar Tree effectively shielded most of the signal (limited the range to 100 feet).  To resolve this I simply added about 20 feet of wire beginning near the sensor (a small loop or two) and running around the tree to the area that would give me a line of sight.  This effectively extended the range without having to actually attach or break into the sensor.  Now the unit works as advertised.  I now need to talk to the paper boy about turning around in our drive at 5 am.

Reviews.Title: It Works
Reviews.Author: Rodney E. Colling "Grandpa"
Reviews.Content: This item worked first time right out of the box. Installation so simple even grandpa did it in under two minutes. This very affordable unit is portable so you can have the receiver almost any where you are or want it to be. Best thing about it. "It Works"

Reviews.Title: excellent product and very affordable
Reviews.Author: Eric V.A. "ericdred"
Reviews.Content: i got this item for my work. every time my patient wakes up and gets up of bed, it wakes me up immediately so i'm always ready to help him whatever he needs. i just put the sensor under his bed, so the moment his right foot touches the floor, i'm already up no matter how deeply i was sleeping. this product is excellent for me and also very cheap. but i'm just wondering if they could make one that will vibrate in my wrist aside from making a sound to wake me up. in other words, it would be perfect if i could select from sound mode or vibrate mode. in vibrate mode, it will not wake someone else coz even the low volume setting of this gadget is loud enough during night time. it would be perfect also if they could just make an optional receiver unit - the vibrating one (for the wrist) - that i could just buy additionally for my existing unit. to TELEBrands: maybe if this idea would sell, it surely could, i'm the first customer, then please give me 30% of all the profit you will make- for some kind of intellectual property rights, hehehe....

Reviews.Title: Driveway motion detector
Reviews.Author: M. Newman
Reviews.Content: The Driveway Patrol does tell us when a person or car passes in front of it.  But it also tells us if waving branches in high winds or frisky squirrels jump in front of it.  We have narrowed its scope to 1/8 inch and trimmed nearby shrubs but still get about 4 false alarms a day (never at night).  However, I think the times it is actually monitoring are worth the slight annoyance of the over sensitivity.

Reviews.Title: Good product for price
Reviews.Author: steelman
Reviews.Content: this product was easy to set up, we got it mainly to know when someone showed up to pick up the kids.  It is a little too sensitive at times, so we usually leave it turned off and just turn the switch on when we are expecting company so that we are alerted when they arrive.For the price, its a good buy.

Reviews.Title: excellent product for home security
Reviews.Author: Russell Coleman
Reviews.Content: I have placed multiple sensors around my property for nighttime security. The sensors work great but take a little time adjusting the location and placement height of the motion sensor. I would recommend this to anyone who wants motion sensors for outdoor movement at night.

Reviews.Title: Does exactly what it says...
Reviews.Author: F. Maltez "FM"
Reviews.Content: For the price, it does exactly what it says and does it well. I get advance notice (via beeping) that someone is approaching the front door and garage. Not a lot of bells and whistles, but works great!

Reviews.Title: Works, but buyer beware
Reviews.Author: R. Kuipers
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these a year ago. It stopped working after 14 months.When it worked, it worked well. Few false alarms (mostly because of the sun hitting it at a certain angle).For the money, I suppose it's worth it, but not much more!

Reviews.Title: Very good product
Reviews.Author: markcho "mc"
Reviews.Content: Working is very well, but fails in the hot day time.In the room, works excellence.  Anyway, this is a good product.I would like to recommend it for indoor using. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product and Quick Shipping Service
Reviews.Author: AFColonel
Reviews.Content: Product is much better than I expected based on the low price.  I purchased this unit to help protect landscaping around a new home from being dug up and destroyed during the night by varmints such as armadillos and wild ferrell hogs running free in my new development.  It has worked well for me as I have already 'dispatched' two of the varmints to their final reward while in the process of digging!

Reviews.Title: Great Price, Great Performance!
Reviews.Author: C. Celestino "Clay"
Reviews.Content: This product works fine. It's very sensitive and, so far, after 1 month with it working on my backyard, I got no false alarms (except for when my neighbor walks on the side of his house, on the other side of our wired fence, some 100 ft distant.The only thing I don't like is the fact that I have no options to change the "alarm" from chime to siren and no way we can change/set the level of sensitivity of the motion sensor.

Reviews.Title: Good for indoor use
Reviews.Author: S. Bouchard "Salt&Light;"
Reviews.Content: Driveway Patrol Sensor and Receiver KitWe use this in a retail store to alert us when customers have come in.  It catches most of the customers, but if they walk in too quickly, sometimes it won't go off.  We have none of the problems others have reported with outdoor use.  For the most part we are very happy with the product for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: Works extremely well, especially for $13
Reviews.Author: D. Bassett "-The Hooligan Hunter"
Reviews.Content: I ordered it Tuesday for about $13, put the $20 expedited on it, got it Friday, and used it all weekend.  These guys shipped it the very next day.  It came with some free comedy that was kind of funny...  Unfortunately, nobody tried to ceran-wrap my car over the weekend so I didn't get to put it to a real life test, but it did pass all the tests me and the guys put it through.  Only one false alarm so far, works great in cold weather. It's like $18 with regular shipping, so it's definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: these things are fantastic
Reviews.Author: Dennis E. Talasco
Reviews.Content: I've had mine a few months now and so far the batteries are still going strong & the device works beautifully. It's very sensitive and yet it's not set off by birds which is great. Nor is it affected by the movementof tree branches & yet if my very small dog comes near it, it sounds.  I've actually bought two more as a back up because this is one product I wouldn't want to ever be without.

Reviews.Title: Great wireless alarm -- except when the temp is over 90 degrees!
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: UPDATE OF MY REVIEW DUE TO JULY 2006 HEAT WAVE: I have two of these low-cost alarms set up, and both become quite intermittent when the temperature reaches 90 degrees and above (in the shade): Sometimes they go off when a person/car goes past, and sometimes they do not. As soon as the temperature decreases though, they become much more reliable. I WOULD NOT RECOMENDED THESE DEVICES FOR SECTIONS OF THE COUNTRY WITH HOT WEATHER, SUCH AS ARIZONA, TEXAS, NEW MEXICO, ETC. Original review: I am very impressed with this alarm: It is accurately able to detect people coming up the stairs of my apartment, and sets off the indoor alarm -- and it has not sent out any false alarms (Most problems with this alarm (that I have read in the reviews below) appear to be caused by the sensor being in direct sun light. This seems to cause these units numerous difficulties, and should have been addressed in the Patrol Sensor's enclosed instructions -- but isn't. However, by simply shielding the outdoor sensor from all *direct* contact with the light of the sun by using tape or opaque plastic, or repositioning the outdoor sensor, appears to eliminate false alarms or no alarms). This alarm unit appears to be quite well made, and the price is, of course, incredibly low. Great buy!!

Reviews.Title: wont shut off
Reviews.Content: I recieved this product from the wife as a christmas present and when I installed the battries it would not shut of except when i shut the reciever off or when i disconnected the batteries.  It even worked for a few seconds after the 9v battery was disconnected from the sending unit.  Needless to say I was very dissapointed with this unit I have written to the company for advice

Reviews.Title: Defective

Reviews.Content: Unbelievable - the product received didn't work.  Since amazon is not the seller, the seller doesn't accept returns, says I must deal with the manufacturer; I say to the prospective buyers - buy only from amazon directly so you can return if the product doesn't work

Reviews.Content: These guys are super crazy... if they do not like your review they will call you and email you none stop to change the review or cancel it... HARRASMENT!!! get a life.
